General text: The DPS i-series by KONGSBERG offers a sensor-fusioned GNSS solution for dynamic positioning, leveraging decades of experience within GNSS and inertial technology. It emphasizes operational efficiency for DP applications by integrating the latest multi-GNSS technology and KONGSBERG's unique motion constellation GNSS technology, enabling a cost-efficient and reliable position reference solution. The DPS i-series is fully prepared to utilize differential corrections and SBAS services when required, and it utilizes data from GPS and GLONASS. The integration between GNSS and INS ensures continuous position solution by bridging gaps in the GNSS reception and increasing position stability in periods with limited GNSS availability due to masking, scintillation, and interference. The system also offers RAIM extended by data from the INS, providing ultimate reliability of the position and velocity data under difficult GNSS conditions. The DPS i-series has an intuitive and easy-to-use graphical user interface developed in close cooperation with experienced DP operators, enabling operators to assess the quality of their positioning quickly and effectively during operation. It is also ready for K-IMS remote services for operational support and troubleshooting, allowing for remote resolution of cases that previously required a visit from a service engineer.
Features:
- Multi-frequency GPS, GLONASS, and SBAS receiver (optional)
- Highly optimized integration of INS and GNSS without the use of 3rd party DGNSS services
- Dual frequency ionospheric compensation
- INS aided RAIM capability for enhanced integrity and GNSS antenna reliability
- Fully capable to utilize differential correction services if required
- High-precision lever arm compensation of position and velocity
- Intuitive and easy-to-use HMI tailored to safety-critical DP operations
- Scalable solution
- GNSS heading (requires two DPS systems)
- Spoofing detection capabilities
- Automatic data recording with replay functionality
- Remote service and diagnostics by utilizing K-IMS
Technical Specifications:
PERFORMANCE WEIGHTS AND DIMENSIONS
- Non-differential position accuracy: 1.3 m, 95% CEP
- RTK 1 cm + 1.6 ppm RMS
- High precision accuracy < 10 cm, 95% CEP
- DGNSS position accuracy < 1 m, 95% CEP
- SBAS position accuracy < 1 m, 95% CEP
- Velocity accuracy < 0.01 m/s, 95% CEP
- Roll, pitch accuracy: MRU 5+: 0.007° RMS, MGC R2: 0.01° RMS, DPS HMI Unit 3.6 kg, 44 x 481 x 267 mm, MGC R3: 0.007° RMS
POWER SPECIFICATIONS
- DPS Processing Unit: 100 - 240 V AC, 50/60 Hz, max 75 W
- DPS HMI Unit: 100 - 240 V AC, 50/60 Hz, max 170 W
- GNSS antenna: 5 V DC from Processing Unit
ENVIRONMENTAL SPECIFICATIONS
- Operating temperature range: DPS Processing Unit -15 to +55 ºC, DPS HMI Unit +5 to +35 ºC, GNSS antenna -40 to +85 ºC
- Interfaces: Serial ports, 8 isolated ports, 6 configurable between RS-232 and RS-422, IMU RS-422, Ethernet/LAN 4, USB 3
DATA OUTPUTS: NMEA 0183 v. 3.0, Proprietary, Message types ABBDP, ARABB, DPGGA, DTM, GBS, GGA, GLL, GNS, GRS, GSA, GST, GSV, RMC, VBW, VER, VTG, ZDA

General text: The Kongsberg Telemetry system is designed to enhance control and safety during offloading operations by providing real-time 'green-line' offloading control activated manually or automatically. It is based on dual SeaGnal MB45 controllers operating in parallel on different frequencies for enhanced redundancy. This system can work as a standalone system on both the FPSO and the Shuttle Tanker, or be integrated with the vessel’s DARPS system for control and monitoring of 'green-line' status. The Telemetry system also features reliable two-way communication, robustness against in-band interference, unique ID for integrity, well-marked Emergency Stop switch, support for both analogue and digital interfaces to external equipment, ease of installation and maintenance, limited operator training needed, flexible configuration, and the ability to monitor 'green-line' status on a portable setup. Additionally, ANATEL approval ensures compliance with relevant product standards.
Features:
Key Features:
- Reliable two-way communication using two separate controllers with UHF at different frequencies in parallel
- Robust against in-band interference due to specialized communication protocol with low latency
- Exclusive 'one-to-one' communication links established between FPSO and SHT
- Unique ID ensures integrity
- Well-marked Emergency Stop switch
- Supports both analogue and digital interface to external equipment
- Easy installation and maintenance
- Ease of operation with 2-line display and keypad, limited operator training needed
- Flexible configuration
- 'Green-line' status can be monitored on a portable solution
- ANATEL approved

MARITIME BROADBAND RADIO

General text: The Maritime Broadband Radio is a smart antenna designed for use in maritime applications where digital high-speed reliable communication and data transfer are crucial for efficient and safe operations. With compact design and tilted antennas suitable for helmet mounting, the MBR 144 Personal is intended for operations where personnel requires a robust communication link during surveillance and inspection. The MBR 144 Personal has integrated antennas and GNSS positioning. The MBR 144 Personal is also available with a dedicated plug-and-play camera for live streaming, and battery packs. MBR is in conformity with RED directive 2014/53/EU, EMC ETSI EN 301 843-1, ETSI EN 301 843-7, IEC 60945/EN 60945, ETSI EN 303 276, IEC 61010-1/EN 61010-1, IEC 60945/EN 60945.

datasheet_name: The product name and header from the text is "µPAP 201-C".
General text: The µPAP 201-C is a system designed for tracking ROV’s, tow fish, divers and other subsea objects. It provides all the necessary parts for a full system in a compact transducer housing, making it well suited for USV installation. This integrated SSBL acoustic positioning solution comes complete with motion sensor and processing unit integrated in one subsea housing. The system can be remotely controlled from an external computer via Ethernet access, allowing the user to control transponders and send data for acoustic modem transfer to a modem on a subsea vehicle. APOS, the operator station for µPAP, provides a full range of functions for acoustic positioning and data communication, benefitting from the Cymbal acoustic protocol and all functions available for the HiPAP products. µPAP has full LBL calibration and positioning capabilities and offers a wide range of transponder channels and cNODE transponder models for depths down to 4000 metres. It has built-in motion sensors for compensating the position for vessels' roll and pitch movements, with no need for calibration of roll and pitch alignments but requiring calibration for alignment to the vessel's gyro compass. The system can be interfaced to the vessel heading sensor and GNSS system, with data output available in established formats for user access.
Features:
• Compact transducer housing
• Integrated SSBL acoustic positioning solution
• Remote control via Ethernet
• APOS operator station for full range of functions
• Full LBL calibration and positioning capabilities
• Wide range of transponder channels and cNODE transponder models
• Built-in motion sensors for compensating vessel movements
• Interfacing capability with vessel heading sensor and GNSS system
• Data output available in established formats

datasheet_name: The product name and header from the text is "MRU 3".
General text: THE HEAVE, ROLL AND PITCH MOTION SENSOR This fifth generation roll, pitch and heave motion sensor is specially designed for heave compensation applications. The MRU 3 model is typically used for real-time roll, pitch and heave compensation of echosounders, fishing sonars and offshore cranes. The unit provides heave position and velocity, and outputs roll, pitch and heave together with linear acceleration in 3-axes. The PFreeHeave algorithm incorporated in the MRU 3 uses past measurements to output a correct and phase-free heave. It is suitable for applications that can utilize a delayed heave signal, such as typical seabed mapping applications. The MRU 3 accepts input of external speed and heading vector information for improved accuracy in heave, roll and pitch during turns and accelerations. It has high output data rate (200 Hz) and achieves precise heave at long wave periods by use of PFreeHeave algorithms. The unit is small-sized, light-weight, and has low power consumption. Each MRU is delivered with a Calibration Certificate and comes with a 2-year warranty. Export license is not required, and selectable communication protocols are available in the Windows based MRU configuration software.
Features: 0.08° roll and pitch accuracy, Outputs real-time roll, pitch and heave measurements, Outputs on RS-232, RS-422 and Ethernet, High output data rate (200 Hz), Precise heave at long wave periods by use of PFreeHeave algorithms, Lever arm compensation to two individually configurable monitoring points, Meets IHO special order requirements, Small size, light weight and low power consumption, Each MRU delivered with Calibration Certificate, Selectable communication protocols in the Windows based MRU configuration software, Export license not required, 2-year warranty

General text: The XPR 100 EX is a microwave-based solution developed for DP applications in need of long-range relative positioning. With no moving parts and with its compact and lightweight design, installation is simple and quick. Operating in the 9.2-9.3 GHz band, the XPR 100 operates in all weather conditions and has an unmatched performance in range and bearing accuracy. Each lightweight sensor unit has an opening angle of 100°. The XPR 100 can be deployed as an omni directional system utilizing several sensor units, providing an extended operational area as well as avoidance of blind angles. The XPR 100 EX is suitable to be installed in hazardous locations where there may be an explosive mixture of flammable gases belonging to gas group II B and/or II A. The XPR 100 is designed to fill the need specified by IMO for DP Class 2 vessels. Targets are stored in the system, and continuous monitoring in all directions mitigates false target lock and secures a very fast target acquisition. Prior to operation, the XPR 100 performs a check and verification of the system to secure a safe and efficient operation. The XPR 100 features a highly intuitive HMI enabling the operators to assess the quality of their positioning quickly and effectively during operation.
Features: Key Features: - No moving parts - Compact and lightweight sensor units - Easy and quick installation - Support for multi-sensor site for extended operational area (100-280° coverage) - Automatic built-in system test – prior to operation - Automatic target selection

General text: RADIUS HIGH PRECISION POSITION REFERENCE AND TRACKING SYSTEM RADius is a robust and reliable relative positioning system developed for DP applications. It is a fully solid state system with low maintenance costs, based on radar principles. The system utilizes innovative technology for the direction from the interrogator to each transponder, accurately determined by the use of interferometric measurements of reflected radar signals from passive transponders. RADius features a highly intuitive touch-ready HMI developed in close co-operation with experienced DP operators, enabling the assessment of positioning quickly and effectively during operation. RADius can be deployed as an omni directional system utilizing four sensor heads, providing full 360˚ signal acquisition and avoidance of blind angles. Signal processing effectively removes possible interference with other transmitting devices in the same frequency band. Retroreflective transponders are mounted on the target to be approached, and a variety of transponders are available, suitable for any operation that demands a robust and reliable relative positioning solution. The system has a DP range of up to 550m and offers range accuracy of 0.25m, angle accuracy of 0.25°, and an update frequency rate of 5Hz.
Features:
Key Features:
- Fully solid state system
- Utilizes innovative radar principles
- Highly intuitive touch-ready HMI
- Can be deployed as an omni directional system
- Effective signal processing
- Retroreflective transponders for accurate range and bearing measurements
- DP range of up to 550m

Performance Environmental Specifications:

General text: SENSOR FUSIONED GNSS SOLUTION FOR DYNAMIC POSITIONING By the introduction of the DPS i-series, KONGSBERG fuses decades of experience within GNSS and inertial technology in order to create a fully scalable and future-proof reference solution with emphasis on operational efficiency for DP applications. An unmatched integration of the latest within multi GNSS Inertial technology combined with the latest multi- and KONGSBERG’s unique motion gyro compass (MGC™) constellation GNSS technology enables a cost efficient and reliable position reference solution. The flexible design of the DPS i-series ensures a scalable and expandable reference solution that can adapt to the specific requirements of any vessel. For the more demanding applications, a combination of multiple DPS systems and MGC/MRU sensors will enable precise heading determination world wide and provide spoofing detection capabilities. The DPS i-series has an intuitive and easy-to-use graphical user interface developed in close co-operation with experienced DP operators. The DPS i-series is ready for K-IMS remote services for operational support and troubleshooting. Cases that previously required a visit from a service engineer, may now be resolved remotely. The integration ensures a continuous position solution by bridging gaps in the GNSS reception and increasing position stability in periods with limited GNSS availability due to masking, scintillation and interference. By using the MGC as the inertial sensor, a high-quality gyro compass becomes a part of the solution. In addition, MGC can serve other on-board systems such as navigation equipment and other systems that require attitude data.
Features:
- Multi-frequency GPS, GLONASS, Beidou, Galileo and SBAS receiver
   - Highly optimized integration of INS and GNSS without the use of 3rd party DGNSS services
   - Dual frequency ionospheric compensation
   - INS aided RAIM capability for enhanced integrity and reliability
   - Fully capable to utilize differential correction services if required
   - High-precision lever arm compensation of position and velocity
   - Intuitive and easy-to-use HMI tailored to safety critical DP operations
   - Scalable solution
   - GNSS heading (requires two GPS systems)
   - Spoofing detection capabilities
   - Automatic data recording with replay functionality
   - Remote service and diagnostics by utilizing K-IMS
Technical Specifications:
PERFORMANCE Non-differential position accuracy 1 0.65 m 95% CEP
High precision accuracy 2 < 10 cm, 95% CEP
DGNSS position accuracy < 1 m, 95% CEP
SBAS position accuracy < 1 m, 95% CEP

datasheet_name: The product name and header in the text is "Transducer 15 - 17".
General text: The 15 - 17 transducer is designed for ocean depth and subbottom details in shallow water. It features a single beam with a width of 17° and is equipped with low Q and low frequency ceramic arrays for accurate measurement. With 13 elements encapsulated in a cast Urethane housing, it is suitable for use as a portable mount. The transducer's technical specifications include a resonant frequency of 15 kHz, circular beam width of 17 degrees, directivity, impedance nominal value of 60 ohms, transmitting and receiving voltage responses, electroacoustic efficiency, maximum power input, cable length and diameter, weight, and storage temperature.
Features:
- Single beam transducer
 - Designed for ocean depth and subbottom details
 - Low Q and low frequency ceramic arrays
 - 13 elements encapsulated in a cast Urethane housing
 - Suitable for use as a portable mount
Technical Specifications:
Resonant frequency: 15 kHz
Beam width: 17 degrees
Directivity: D = 100, DI = 19.9 ±1 dB
Equivalent two-way beam angle: Ψ = 0.049, 10 log Ψ = -13 ±1 dB
Side lobes: Less than 17 dB
Impedance nominal value: 60 ohm
Transmitting Voltage Response: 165 ±2 dB re 1μPa per V
Receiving Voltage Response: -169 ±2 dB re 1 V per μPa
Electroacoustic efficiency: 0.45
Maximum pulse power input: 3.5 kW @ 2% duty
Maximum continuous power input: 70 W
Cable length: 15 m
Cable diameter: 10 mm
Weight with/without cable: 28 / 25 kg
Storage temperature: +48 to -6°C

General text: The EA 400/600 Sidescan echo sounder with combined sidescan and depth soundings offers valuable features for hydrographic echo sounders. It provides a side-looking option for producing images on the side of the vessel where the transducer is located, enabling simultaneous surveying of both sides. Another advantageous solution is the use of hull-mounted or over-the-side boom-mounted sidescan transducers for surveying shallow areas. The side-looking option is equally useful for searching wrecks or surveying navigable channels for obstacles. The system is easy to operate, allowing for the capture and storage of sidescan data in a digital format. Kongsberg Maritime's sidescan transducers offer high accuracy, resolution, and robustness with wide coverage, making them suitable for revealing the secrets of the seafloor. The system allows for easy presentation and data processing, as well as the exportation of Georef output datagram through the network if a vertical channel is available.
Features:
- Side-looking option available for producing images
 - Use of hull-mounted or over-the-side boom-mounted sidescan transducers
 - Easy capture and storage of sidescan data in a digital format
 - High accuracy, resolution, and robustness with wide coverage for the sidescan transducers
Technical Specifications:
120-2x50 Sidescan transducer: Transversal beamwidth - 55.0 degrees; Maximum pulse power input - 1000 W; Maximum continuous power input - 10 W; Measuring slant range (approx.) - 0 to 300 m; Survey speed (max) - 6 - 8 knots; Cable length - 20 m; Resonant frequency - 120 kHz; Weight with cable - 5.5 kg.
200-0.5x49 Sidescan transducer: Transversal beamwidth - 49.0 degrees; Maximum pulse power input - 1000 W; Maximum continuous power input - 27 W; Measuring slant range (approx.) - 0 to 200 m; Survey speed (max) - 6 - 8 knots; Cable length - 20 m; Resonant frequency - 200 kHz; Weight with cable - 8 kg.

Product_Name: Single beam echo sounder, remote display
Scraped Text:
RD301 User manual
Instruction manual
Remote display RD301
Digital depth repeater
RD301 User manual
INTRODUCTION
The RD301 remote display is made for use with the EA400/
EA600 and the EN 250 navigation echo sounder. It may also be
used with other echo sounders, if they have NMEA0183 output.
The RD301 is a depth repeater with alarm setting. The operator
may select alarm depth in the meny.
Maximum depth readings are 9999 m and a resolution of 0.1 m.
Brightness is adjusted on the front panel. Brightness can,
optionally, also be adjusted from a remote controller.
OPERATION
1. To switch the unit on: Press any key.
To switch the unit off: At the same time, press both the Up
and the Down key.
2. To adjust brigthness: Press the Up/Down keys to find suitable
setting.
3. To select depth alarm: Press the S key once and enter alarm setting
mode. The display shows “SetA“. Set the wanted depth by
using the Up and Down keys. When wanted alarm depth is
set, the unit will go back to normal mode operation after 15
seconds, or press S to the depth occur. When depth below
transducer become the same, or less, than the alarm depth,
the display will indicate “AL“ alternating with actual depth.
To set alarm off: Repeat operation number 3. and set alarm
depth to 0 m.
4. To select readings in feet, meters or fathoms: Press the S key
twice and enter alarm setting mode. The display shows “SetU “.
Select requested reading by pressing the Up or Down key. When
readings is set, the unit will go back to normal mode operation
after 15 sec, or press S to the depth occur.
5. To select transducer position (Only for EN 250): Press the S
key three times and enter the transducer selection mode. The dis-
play shows “SetP”. Press the Up/Down keys to select between
the four choices: Unknown, Forward, Backward or Auto.
- The Unknown selection decode any NMEA depth message and
shows the depth on the display. The position leds will then be
off.
- The other selections decode the NMEA message $PSKPDPT.
If Forward is selected, only the readings from the forward
transducer is shown, and if Backward is selected, only the
readings from the backward transducer is shown.
- The Auto selection switches between Forward, Backward
and Unknown depending on the NMEA messages available.
The led for positions will shift automatically and blink every
third second, indicating that the Auto selection is active. If
the transducer position is unknown, both leds will be on and
blinking.

General text: The RD301 remote display is designed for use with the EA400/EA600 and the EN 250 navigation echo sounder, as well as other echo sounders with NMEA0183 output. It serves as a depth repeater with alarm setting and allows the operator to select the alarm depth. The maximum depth readings are 9999 m with a resolution of 0.1 m. Brightness can be adjusted on the front panel or from a remote controller. The unit can be switched on by pressing any key and off by simultaneously pressing the Up and Down keys. Additionally, it offers the ability to select depth alarms, readings in feet, meters, or fathoms, and transducer position for the EN 250 model. The RD301 also accepts specific NMEA messages and is to be panel mounted following outlined instructions. Notably, it operates within specific environmental conditions and comes with instructions regarding wiring and connecting, along with a disclaimer about the manual's use and copyright information.
Features:
Key Features and Operations:
- Designed for use with EA400/EA600 and EN 250 echo sounders
- Depth repeater with alarm setting
- Maximum depth readings of 9999 m
- Adjustable brightness
- Ability to select depth alarms, readings in feet, meters, or fathoms
- Transducer position selection for EN 250
- Accepts specific NMEA messages
- Panel mounting instructions
- Specific operating environmental conditions
- Wiring and connecting instructions
- Disclaimer and copyright information

datasheet_name: HWS, which stands for Hydrographic Work Station, can serve as a product name and header.
General text: The small and powerful HWS is a 1U high Hydrographic Work Station designed for interface access and the ability to work with high data rates and graphics rendering. It supports four displays for real-time data from EM multibeam echosounders and is equipped with SSD or NVMe data disks. This system is powered by an IntelCore I7-8700T processor with 16 GB RAM, Windows 10, and maritime certifications IEC60945 and E10. The compact HWS is suitable for maritime environments and can be used with various KM products. Four standard installation options are available for the HWS, including VESA-mount behind the display, VESA-mount under the desk, 19’’ rack mount fixed shelf, and 19’’ rack mount sliding drawer. The HWS highlights include easy removal, multiple network interfaces, USB-C and USB-A connections, DisplayPort connections, and VESA-installation behind-the-display or under-the-desk. It also offers options for moving data efficiently through USB-C, network connections, and external SSD drives. Additionally, the HWS serves as the preferred unit for SBP 27/29, TOPAS, and EA440/640, offering add-ons such as external power, external SSD for data transfer, fixed rack mount, and expandable RAM. SBP 27/29 and TOPAS are sub-bottom profiler systems, while EA440/640 are single-beam hydrographic echo sounders tailored for various hydrographic applications.
Features:
Key Features:
- Compact 1U high Hydrographic Work Station
- Supports four displays for real-time data
- Powered by IntelCore I7-8700T processor with 16 GB RAM
- Maritime certifications IEC60945 and E10
- Four standard installation options available
- Multiple network interfaces and high-speed data transfer connections
- Easy removal and maintenance
- External power and SSD options for efficient data transfer
- Suitable for SBP 27/29, TOPAS, and EA440/640 integration

TOPAS PS18
PARAMETRIC SUB-BOTTOM PROFILER
TOPAS PS18 is designed for sub-bottom profiling with very high spatial resolution in water depths from less
than 20 metres to full ocean depth. The +80% relative bandwidth, low frequency signal is generated in the
water column by non-linear interaction between two high frequency signals (centred symmetrically around
18 kHz). Similarly, a sum frequency signal is also generated. However, only the low frequency
signal is used for sub-bottom profiling.

General text: The TOPAS PS18 parametric sub-bottom profiler by Kongsberg is designed to provide high spatial resolution for sub-bottom profiling in various water depths, from less than 20 meters to full ocean depth. The system offers a relative bandwidth of +80% and generates a low frequency signal through non-linear interaction between two high frequency signals, resulting in efficient survey time and improved positioning accuracy for the profile. The hull-mounted transducer eliminates the need for tow-fishes during the survey, enhancing manoeuvrability and achieving excellent profiling results even at speeds of over 14 knots. The system can operate with various signal waveforms for optimum performance, including Ricker pulses for high resolution work, Chirp pulses for deep water, and CW pulses for frequency sensitive work. The system's parametric sources can achieve penetration performance of more than 200 meters in water depths exceeding 3,800 meters, with sediment layer resolution of typically 15 cm or better. The narrow acoustic beam, high bandwidth, electronic beam steering, and real-time processing are among the key benefits of the system.
Features:
• Narrow acoustic beam
• High bandwidth
• Chirp and short pulse modes
• No sidelobes
• Electronic beam steering
• Single ping, multi ping and burst ping modes
• Real-time processing
• Heave, roll and pitch stabilised beam
• Hull mounted transducer
• High spatial resolution

General text: The TTC unit is designed for on deck acoustic testing and configuration of cNODE transponders. It can test all KM transponder channels including the latest Cymbal MST transponders acoustic protocols and telemetry transponders with internal and external sensors. There are two available TTC models: TTC 30 (Medium frequency) and TTC 10 (Low frequency). The TTC units come with 1 x Test Transducer, 1 x Serial Line Cable, and 1 x Mains Power Cable. The TTC is a touch screen/trackball operated transponder tester set in a splash-proof portable case with carrying handle and shoulder strap. It has an internal rechargeable battery and is capable of acoustic interrogation, read/set transponder parameters, reading internal and default channels, SW download, and power supply configuration.
Features: Key features of the TTC unit include: - Designed for on deck acoustic testing and configuration of cNODE transponders - Can test all KM transponder channels including telemetry transponders with internal and external sensors - Available in two models: TTC 30 (Medium frequency) and TTC 10 (Low frequency) - Comes with Test Transducer, Serial Line Cable, and Mains Power Cable - Touch screen/trackball operated with an internal rechargeable battery

General text: The AIS AQ610 from Kongsberg is an Automatic Identification System specifically designed for offshore maritime operations, such as wind energy and aquaculture farms. It complies with international standards including IEC 62320-1/-2 and ITU M-1371-5, with a sensitivity better than -115 dBm and a 1U 19’’ rack mountable smooth design. It receives and communicates AIS data from all AIS sources within the VHF coverage area, while supporting remote configuration and firmware update via a web interface. The system has proven to be a valuable tool for increasing situational awareness and operational efficiency, offering special functions like electronic AIS marking, integration with meteorological sensors, and local vessel AIS monitoring for tracking own workboats and vessels entering/leaving the area of operation. In addition, it allows for remote monitoring of vessel activity from the main control center for logistic purposes.
Features:
Key Features:
- Sensitivity better than -115 dBm
- SNMP v.2
- WEB interface for remote configuration and software update
- Three remotely configurable receivers (TDMA/DSC)
- USB interface for firmware update
- Transmission of virtual AtoN, implementation of a subset of IEC 62320-2 functionality
- Serial interface, data (RS-232)
- Optional combined 100 to 240 V AC and 24 V DC version
- Supporting NTP as client and server
- Interface to meteorological sensors (option)
- Own position message (synthetic VDO) for map presentation
Technical Specifications:
AIS AQ610
- Communication ports: RS-232, LAN 100 Mbs BaseT Ethernet
- Message formats: NMEA
- VHF transmitter: 12.5 W or 1 W (remotely switchable)
- Sensitivity: Better than -115 dBm
- Bandwidth: 25 kHz
- Frequencies: 156.025 to 162.025 MHz
- Default Channels: 87B (161.975 MHz), 88B (162.025 MHz)
- Protocol: FATDMA
- GNSS receivers: 50 channels
- Operating temperature range: AIS Unit -15 to +55 ºC, GNSS antenna -50 to +70 ºC, VHF antenna -55 to +70 ºC
- Humidity: AIS Unit < 95 % relative, non-condensing
- Electrical safety standards: EN 60950-1
- Weight and dimensions: AIS Unit 3 kg, 44 mm x 485 mm x 345 mm
- Power specifications: AIS Unit 100 to 240 V AC (50 to 60 Hz), AIS Unit 24 V DC, Optional combined 100 to 240 V AC and 24 V DC, Average power consumption: 9 W, peak 39 W

General text: The AIS 300BF is an enhanced version of the type approved AIS 300 class A mobile station, offering secure communication in addition to standard AIS functionality. It is designed for integration with other navigation equipment such as ECDIS and radar. The AIS 300BF has three different modes: Standard AIS class A mode, Receive only mode, and Secure mode (encrypted). It features easy installation and maintenance, as well as configuration via a built-in WEB user interface (UI). The unit is built for integration with ECDIS/radar and provides interfaces for AIS target information to improve reliability of received navigation data from other vessels.
Features:
VHF antenna
- Three different modes
- Enhanced sensitivity
- Reception of all types of internationally approved AIS messages including, but not restricted to, class A mobile, class B mobile, AtoN and AIS base station
- Three separate AIS channels
- Static data, dynamic data, voyage related data
- Safety related messaging
- Easy integration via network or serial interfaces
- Transmission of message 27 on SAT AIS frequencies
- 7” multifunction touch display for configuration, operation and monitoring
- Mode switch (option) for effective swiching between modes
Technical Specifications:
AIS 300BF
- Performance: Position accuracy 5 m (DGPS optional), Velocity 0.05 m/s (DGPS optional), Output rate 1 Hz
- Weights and Dimensions: AIS Unit 1.3 kg, 260 x 133 x 54 mm, GPS antenna 0.15 kg, 230 x 33 mm, VHF antenna 1.0 kg, 1250 mm
- Power Specifications: AIS Unit input voltage +24 V DC (op. range 12 to 32 V DC), Consumption 9 W average, 39 W peak
- Environmental Specifications: Operating temperature range -15 to +55 °C, Humidity 0 to 95 % RH, VHF antenna and GPS antenna 100 % hermetically sealed
- Radio Module Standards and Regulations: VHF transmitter 12.5 W/1 W, Protocol SOTDMA/DSC, Frequencies 156.025 to 162.025 MHz band, Default CH87B (161.975 MHz), Default CH88B (162.025 MHz), CH70 (156.525 MHz)/GMSK IWW, SAT 1 (156.775 MHz), SAT 2 (156.825 MHz), MTBF (hours) 40.000
- GPS Module (internal receiver): 50-channel GPS receiver (all in view), Position accuracy (GPS) 15 m RMS, Position accuracy (DGPS) 5 m RMS, Output rate 1 Hz
- Options Input/Output: GPS, heading, rate of turn (Input), ECDIS/ECS/RADAR, Standard PI
- Encryption: Blowfish, AES

General text: The cNODE MiniS Transponder with remote transducer is designed for installation on ROV’s, drones/AUV’s and towed bodies where for practical installation reasons a remote transducer is required. The Transponder includes all the features of the standard MiniS models, can be configured by RS232 line or by acoustic telemetry and is fully compatible with HiPAP, µPAP and cPAP medium-frequency underwater positioning systems for precise ranging and positioning utilizing Cymbal acoustic wideband protocol. The cNODE MiniS34-S transponder has a compact housing for the transponder electronics, which can be powered both by the internal rechargeable battery or external power 24 VDC supply. A range of 4000 m depth rated transducers with different beam patterns are offered that can be selected and fitted to optimize mission performance. The transmit power level for the transducers can be stepped in 4 levels to suit remote range and conditions. The unit will operate as any standard cNODE transponder and can be used with Cymbal wideband or FSK signaling. It offers telemetry capability, where the transmit power level or channel can be changed acoustically. The cNODE MiniS34-S has RS232 Comms to setup and change channel.
Features:
• 500+ Cymbal Wideband Channels
• SSBL and LBL Ranging
• Responder Mode
• Rechargeable battery Li-Ion
• External power supply
• Choice of remote range
• Works with HiPAP, µPAP and cPAP
• 4000m depth rating
• RS232 Comms to setup and change channel
Technical Specifications:
cNODE MiniS 34-S

- Signal type: Cymbal wideband and FSK
- Responder and beacon mode: Yes

General text: The EA440 VERMESSUNGSLOT is a new Kongsberg Maritime Multifrequency Echo sounder with 'wide band' technology. It is a completely newly developed multifrequency echo sounder with CW and FM chirp pulse form. The system offers the simultaneous application of different functions like hydrography, sidescan or 'light' sub-bottom in a single device. It provides an easy and intuitive user interface according to the latest KONGSBERG standard with comprehensive display options. The EA440 has a frequency range from 10 kHz to 500 kHz, making it suitable for use in various depths, ranging from 20 cm to 3000 m. With the use of high-quality transducers, it allows for depth measurements even in extremely shallow waters. The system is designed to be operated on Windows 7 and offers the flexibility to operate and display up to eight different frequencies simultaneously on the screen, each independently adjustable as per the specific requirements. The EA440 system consists of the PC operator unit, the transmitter/receiver unit, and the transducers. It features extensive storage options for various data formats and offers high resolution due to its smallest 'sample rate' of 0.6 cm at 500 kHz.
Features:
- Wide band technology
 - Simultaneous application of hydrography, sidescan or 'light' sub-bottom in a single device
 - Frequency range from 10 kHz to 500 kHz
 - Easy and intuitive user interface
 - Operation and display of up to eight different frequencies simultaneously
 - High resolution due to smallest 'sample rate' of 0.6 cm at 500 kHz
Technical Specifications:
- Operating System: Windows 7
 - Frequency Range: 10 kHz – 500 kHz
 - Chirp Pulse Form: CW and FM
 - Display: Echogram, Depth window, Seabed echo, Sidescan display, and Echoscope
 - Send Power: 10W – 1kW
 - Depth Capability: Up to 3000m, and can measure in shallow waters from 20cm
 - Data Output Formats: Extensive options for external communication
 - Send/Receive Unit Dimensions: Height: 84mm, Depth: 213mm, Width: 438mm, Weight: 5kg
 - System Software: Windows 7
 - Bodenerfassung: Software-Erfassungsalgorithmen (einstellbare min/max Tiefe)

General text: Seafloor Information Systems (SIS 5) has been redesigned to improve user experience and work processes, providing a modern and efficient working environment. The new 3D displays handle all depths and background maps are generated from GeoTIFF or S 57 charts using Web Map Services (WMS). SIS Remote offers support for multiple survey vessels, simultaneous control of EM systems, and powerful 3D-graphics. It facilitates remote operations and multi-survey setup, and allows for survey planning in the office and during the survey. SIS also supports .KMall logging format, provides complete documentation in .html format, and features an open API for developers to interface in various ways. Additionally, SIS has a way to manually upload data to the Seabed2030 initiative for mapping the whole world by 2030.
Features: A single SIS installation can support multiple survey vessels. It supports all EM systems simultaneously and the EM system can be controlled from a remote location. It provides control, logging and QA-functionality for the surveyor on the mother ship. SIS uses S-57 background maps from WMS-server, and facilitates remote operations and multi-survey setup fast or slow connections within any price range. SIS supports survey planning in the office and during the survey, and supports .KMall logging format, allowing for easier post-processing. SIS also features an open API for developers to interface in many different ways, and has a way to allow the user to manually upload data to the Seabed2030 initiative for mapping the whole world by 2030.
Technical Specifications: EM™ systems supported: EM 2040 (all models), EM 712, EM 304, EM 124. Operating System: Windows 10. Hardware: Hydrographic Work Station (HWS) IEC 60945 and E10 Maritime Certified Computer. The Digital Terrain Models in SIS can be exported as GeoTIFF files. Computer 19” rack mount recommended for installation.

General text: Next generation real-time software for EM™ systems. Seafloor Information Systems (SIS 5) has been redesigned to improve user experience and work processes. The modern window environment, menus and layout are more intuitive, helping the operator work more efficiently. The new 3D displays handle all depths, even when displaying shallow water multibeams at maximum ping rate. The background maps are generated from GeoTIFF or S 57 charts using Web Map Services (WMS). SIS Remote provides control, logging and QA-functionality for survey vessels via a standard internet connection, such as KONGSBERG’s Marine Broadband Radio (MBR). SIS also facilitates remote operations and multi-survey setup fast or slow connections within any price range. It allows the operator hands-on control of the survey in real time. Survey planning in SIS is available in the office and during the survey. The new design allows for easy planning and transfer of survey plans to the right vessel. SIS supports .KMall, the KONGSBERG logging format used by all EM systems, making it much easier to post-process the logged data. SIS comes with a complete set of documentation in .html format and examples in C++ and Python, shortening the development time for software developers. SIS has an open Application Programmer’s Interface, API, which allows developers to interface in many different ways. SIS can be used to integrate the EM-systems into the ship’s infrastructure of sensors and processing, and also supports sharing of data through the Seabed2030 initiative for mapping the whole world by 2030.
Features: A single SIS installation can support multiple survey vessels. Supports all EM systems simultaneously, with the EM system controllable from a remote real-time location. Powerful 3D-graphics and simultaneous multi-survey ship displays. Uses S-57 background maps from WMS-server. Allows survey planning in the office and during the survey, with easy planning and transfer of survey plans to the right vessel. Supports .KMall, the KONGSBERG logging format, making post-processing of logged data much easier. Complete set of documentation in .html format and examples in C++ and Python. Open Application Programmer’s Interface, API, allowing developers to interface in many different ways. Allows integration of the EM-systems into the ship’s infrastructure of sensors and processing and supports data sharing through the Seabed2030 initiative.
Technical Specifications: EM™ systems supported: EM 2040 (all models), EM 712, EM 304, EM 124. Operating System: Windows 10. Hardware: Hydrographic Work Station (HWS), IEC 60945 and E10 Maritime Certified Computer. Computer: 19” rack mount recommended. The Digital Terrain Models in SIS can be exported as GeoTIFF files into other systems. Installation: SIS 5.

General text: Seafloor Information Systems (SIS 5) has been redesigned in order to improve both user experience and work processes. The modern window environment, menus and layout are more intuitive, helping the operator to work more efficiently. The new 3D displays handle all depths, even when displaying shallow water multibeams at maximum ping rate. The background maps are generated from GeoTIFF or S 57 charts using Web Map Services (WMS). A single SIS installation can support multiple survey vessels. It supports all EM systems simultaneously, and the EM system can be controlled from a remote in real-time location. The connection between the mother ship and the survey vessels is via a standard internet connection, such as KONGSBERG’s Marine Broadband Radio (MBR). Seafloor Information System (SIS 5) facilitates remote operations and multi-survey setup fast or slow connections within any price range. Survey planning in SIS is available in the office and during the survey. The new design allows for easy planning and transfer of survey plans to the right vessel. Planning survey lines in SIS 5 is available in the office and during the survey. The new design allows for easy planning and transfer of survey plans to the right vessel. SIS also supports the .KMall logging format used by all of KONGSBERG's EM systems. SIS has an open Application Programmer’s Interface, API, which allows developers to interface in many different ways. The system also has a way to allow the user to manually upload data to the Seabed2030 initiative for mapping the whole world by 2030. The Digital Terrain Models in SIS can be exported as GeoTIFF files into other systems as well. SIS 5 runs on Windows 10 and is IEC 60945 and E10 Maritime Certified. A 19” rack mount computer is recommended for installation.

3710 DGNSS RECEIVER
DGNSS RECEIVER
The 3710 DGNSS Receiver is a high-performance DGNSS receiver capable of receiving
augmentation data from the Fugro Satellite Positioning worldwide DGNSS Service. The Fugro
service is a full-time differential GNSS (DGNSS) broadcast system delivering differential
corrections from an array of GNSS reference stations located around the globe. These services
include independent sub-decimetre level services (Fugro Seastar G4/G2 and Fugro Seastar XP2),
centimetre level services (Fugro Seastar G2+/G4+) and sub-metre level services (Fugro Seastar
StdL1).
Enhanced availability DGNSS processing
The 3710 DGNSS Receiver gives the user an unmatched The 3710 DGNSS Receiver comprises a software defined
availability in challenging environments where the use of radio (SDR) signal processing core with advanced
differential corrections is vital for an efficient operation. algorithms and true parallel processing of up to two
The 3710 DGNSS Receiver offers reception from both DGNSS satellite signals and one DGNSS Ethernet signal
internet and satellites simultaneously. It has the unique (NTRIP format) simultaneously. DGNSS corrections
capability of simultaneously receiving and outputting from different sources are combined by the unique
data from up to three sources (two satellite links and one multiplexing capability.
internet link). The signals are received via the DGNSS
antenna and by internet. After selection of the desired
broadcast source, the signals are made available as
corrections for use in a GNSS differential capable receiver.

DGNSS IALA antenna (300)
antenna

• Fugro Seastar™ XP/XP2/G2/G2+/G4/G4+/StdL1 capability
• Configurable output for external interfaces
• Integrated 2-line LCD display and keypad for system- GPS antenna (310)configuration and status

• Easy software updates via USB
• Ethernet interface
• Serial interfaceTECHNICAL SPECIFICATIONS

General text: The 3710 DGNSS Receiver is a high-performance DGNSS receiver capable of receiving augmentation data from the Fugro Satellite Positioning worldwide DGNSS Service. The receiver provides enhanced availability DGNSS processing in challenging environments where the use of differential corrections is vital for efficient operation. It offers reception from both DGNSS satellite signals and one DGNSS Ethernet signal simultaneously. The receiver comprises a software-defined radio (SDR) signal processing core with advanced algorithms and true parallel processing of up to two signals. Additionally, it has the unique capability of simultaneously receiving and outputting data from up to three sources (two satellite links and one internet link). The signals are received via the DGNSS antenna and by internet. After the selection of the desired broadcast source, the signals are made available as corrections for use in a GNSS differential-capable receiver.
Features:
• High-performance DGNSS receiver
• Capable of receiving augmentation data from Fugro Satellite Positioning worldwide DGNSS Service
• Enhanced availability DGNSS processing in challenging environments
• Reception from both DGNSS satellite signals and one DGNSS Ethernet signal simultaneously
• Software-defined radio (SDR) signal processing core with advanced algorithms
• True parallel processing of up to two signals
• Unique capability of simultaneously receiving and outputting data from up to three sources
• Integrated 2-line LCD display and keypad for system configuration and status
• Easy software updates via USB
• Ethernet interface
• Serial interface

MBR 144 SUBMERSIBLE
MARITIME BROADBAND RADIO
The Maritime Broadband Radio is a smart antenna designed for use in maritime applications where digital high-speed
reliable communication and data transfer are crucial for efficient and safe operations. The MBR 144 Submersible
allows for resilient and long-range data exchange for surfaced subsea vehicles. The MBR 144 Submersible is certified
for 1000m depth, and has integrated antennas. The sole connection to the MBR 144 Submersible is one connector for
power and Ethernet.

General text:
THE IDEAL MARINE MOTION SENSOR
This fifth generation MRU 5 is specially designed for high precision motion measurements in marine application and for users requiring high accuracy roll, pitch and heave measurements. The MRU 5 is the ideal sensor for motion compensation of multi-beam echo sounders, offshore cranes, hydroacoustic positioning systems and dynamic motion monitoring of roll, pitch and linear accelerations on offshore structures. It provides documented roll and pitch accuracy of 0.02° RMS at a ±5° amplitude and can deliver precise heave at long wave periods by using PFreeHeave algorithms. The MRU 5 features three highly accurate accelerometers and three high-end Kongsberg Seatex developed Micro-Electro-Mechanical-Structures (MEMS) gyros of type MRG (MRU Rate Gyro) for high reliability and accuracy. It accepts input of external speed and heading information for improved accuracy in heave, roll and pitch during turns and accelerations. Additionally, it is delivered with Windows-based configuration and data presentation software, and supports various communication protocols for easy distribution of MRU data to multiple users on board the vessel.
Features:
0.02° roll and pitch accuracy
Outputs on RS-232, RS-422 and Ethernet
High output data rate (200 Hz)
Precise heave at long wave periods by use of PFreeHeave algorithms
Lever arm compensation to two individually configurable monitoring points
Meets IHO special order requirements
Small size, light weight and low power consumption
No limitation to mounting orientation
Each MRU delivered with Calibration Certificate
Selectable communication protocols in the Windows-based MRU configuration software
2-year warranty

General text: The XPR 100 EX LP is a microwave-based solution developed for DP applications in need of long-range relative positioning. With no moving parts and with its compact and lightweight design, installation is quick and easy. Operating in the 9.2-9.3 GHz band, the XPR offers long-range operation under different light conditions, and has an unmatched proven night display. The lightweight sensor unit has an opening angle of 100°, and the system can be deployed as an omni-directional system utilizing several sensor units, providing an extended operational area of up to 280°. The XPR Ex LP is suited for installation in hazardous locations where there may be an explosive mixture of flammable gases belonging to gas group II B and/or II A. The XPR is designed to fill the need specified by IMO for DP Class 2 vessels.
Features:
• No moving parts
• Compact and lightweight sensor units
• Long-range operation under different light conditions
• Operating in the 9.2-9.3 GHz band
• Lightweight sensor unit with an opening angle of 100°
• Can be deployed as an omni-directional system
• Suited for installation in hazardous locations
• Automatic target selection
• Built-in system test and verification
• Highly intuitive HMI
• Support for multi-sensor site for extended operational area

Scraped Text:
RADIUS 550X
EX CERTIFIED BATTERY OPERATED TRANSPONDER
The RADius 550X transponder is a part of the short-distance relative positioning system RADius,
developed for use in applications where the need for a robust and highly accurate relative
positioning system is crucial. The lightweight portable transponder is easy to deploy on targets for
applications that require range and bearing during operation.
EX certified
The RADius 550X low power transponder is an
intrinsically ATEX safe product (category 2) suitable to
be installed in hazardous locations where there may be
an explosive mixture of flammable gases belonging to gas
groups IIB and/or IIA. The transponder can be used in
hazardous zones 1 and 2. IECEx classification is Ex ib IIB
T4 Gb.
Battery powered
The RADius 550X is powered from an intrinsically safe
encapsulated battery with an integral current limiting
resistor and has no wired connection to external
equipment.
Unique ID
The transponders are coded with unique IDs ensuring
reliable identification and tracking of vessels in
demanding environments. Several interrogators can
approach the same transponders, ensuring multi-user
capabilities. Up to five transponders can be tracked
simultaneously by the interrogator. The transponder
is suited with dip switches for easy setting of the
transponder ID.

General text: The product brings value through its high level of efficiency and performance, making it a reliable choice for various applications. General text: The Simrad 18-11 is a large, single-beam transducer with a relatively narrow beam, making it ideal for ocean depth measurement up to a maximum depth of 7000 m. It operates at a resonant frequency of 18 kHz and has a transmitting response of 176 ±2 dB. With an 11 ±2 deg circular beamwidth, the 18-11 transducer offers a receiving sensitivity of -168 ±2 dB and a directivity (D) of 300 ±20%. Its electroacoustic efficiency is 0.60 ±0.20, and it has a DI value of 25 ±1 dB. The maximum pulse power input is 2000 W with a maximum continuous power input of 100 W. The transducer depth is 50 m, and it has a cable length of 20 m and a cable diameter of 11 mm. The transducer weighs 85 kg without the cable and has a storage temperature range of +70 to -20 °C. The impedance has a nominal value of 60 ohm with a maximum variation in |Z| of 45 to 80 ohm and a maximum variation phase angle of ±30 deg. The transducer exhibits side lobes of less than -18 dB and back radiation of less than -35 dB. The data sheet includes detailed information on beam pattern, admittance, installation, outline dimensions, and an installation example. The manufacturer, Simrad AS, is located at Strandpromenaden 50, P.O.Box 111, N-3191 Horten, with contact numbers +47 33 03 40 00 (telephone) and +47 33 04 29 87 (telefax). For more information, visit www.simrad.com.

General text: The EA 600 Series hydrographic single beam echo sounders use Windows XP based software for easy operation. It offers functionality like easy replay and storage with the internal storage of all sample data, individual screen presentation, and system software for multiple channels. The device provides up to four high-power transceivers for simultaneous operation and a variety of highly efficient transducers to suit different operational needs. The system also offers unique features like Windows XP operation, independent frequency operation, built-in bitmap data storage, depth data storage, and a high resolution side-scan option. The EA 600 makes on-line printing of echograms obsolete and allows for data storage internally on the echo sounder’s hard disk and archived on CD ROM.

TOPAS PS40
PARAMETRIC SUB-BOTTOM PROFILER
TOPAS PS40 is designed for sub-bottom profiling with very high spatial resolution in water depths from less
than 4 metres to >2,000 metres. The +80% relative bandwidth, low frequency signal is generated in the
water column by non-linear interaction between two high frequency signals (centred symmetrically around
40 kHz). Similarly a sum frequency signal is also generated. However, only the low frequency signal is used
for sub-bottom profiling.

General text: TOPAS PS40 is a parametric sub-bottom profiler designed for sub-bottom profiling in water depths ranging from less than 4 meters to over 2,000 meters. It offers high spatial resolution and generates a low frequency signal with a relative bandwidth of over 80%. The system can operate with various signal waveforms to ensure optimum performance, using Ricker pulses for high resolution work, Chirp pulses for deep water penetration, and CW pulses for frequency-sensitive work. The system also features a narrow acoustic beam, high bandwidth, electronic beam steering, real-time processing, and hull-mounted transducer, resulting in accurate object location and high spatial resolution. The parametric sources produce a low frequency signal beam with no distinct sidelobe structure, allowing for smooth beam tapering and reducing the possibility of spurious signals due to sidelobes in the received signal. Additionally, the system offers a penetration capability of over 75 meters and a depth range from less than 4 meters to over 2,000 meters.
Features: TOPAS PS40 offers the following key features: - Narrow acoustic beam - High bandwidth - Chirp and short pulse modes - No sidelobes - Electronic beam steering - Single ping, multi ping, and burst ping modes - Real-time processing - Heave, roll, and pitch stabilised beam - Hull mounted transducer - High spatial resolution - Accurate location of objects
Technical Specifications: The typical specification of the system includes primary frequency of 35 – 45 kHz, secondary frequency of 1 – 10 kHz, output power greater than 16 kW, beamwidth of approximately 3.5 degrees for the primary and 3 x 5 degrees for the secondary, source level exceeding 206 dB/ 1µPa@1m at 6 kHz, dynamic range of over 110 dB, range resolution of less than 0.1 m, penetration capability of over 75 m, and a depth range from less than 4 meters to over 2,000 meters. The system interfaces with navigation input, depth input/output, Ethernet, printer/recorder, VRU, synchronizing unit (K-Sync), and features real-time processing with digital band-pass filter, spiking deconvolution/matched filter, time varying filter (TVF), bad trace removal, dereverberation, time variable gain (TVG), automatic volume control (AVC), and more. The system dimensions and weight are as follows: Transceiver - 600 x 574 x 820 mm, 120 Kg; Transducer (standard) - 840 x 534 x 118 mm, 80 Kg.

General text: The AIS RX610 is an automatic identification system receiver based on the new generation AIS Base Station range from Kongsberg. It is designed and tested in accordance with all relevant international standards including IEC 62320-1 and ITU M-1371-5, where applicable. The sensitivity of the AIS RX610 is better than -115 dBm and it has a smooth 1U 19’’ rack mountable design. This AIS receiver is specially designed for optimal signal reception from all AIS sources within the VHF coverage area. The system has proven to be valuable in increasing situational awareness, efficiency of operations, and safety. It also supports remote configuration and operation through an Ethernet/LAN interface, allowing easy interfacing with other equipment or data networks, and remote operation and maintenance. The AIS RX610 also supports configuration and firmware update via a web interface.
Features:
Key Features:
- Sensitivity better than -115 dBm
- SNMP v.2
- WEB interface for remote configuration and software update
- Three remotely configurable receivers (TDMA/DSC)
- USB interface for firmware update
- Serial interface, data (RS-232)
- Optional combined 100 to 240 V AC and 24 V DC version
- Supporting NTP as client and server
- Own position message (synthetic VDO) for map presentation
Technical Specifications:
AIS RX610
- Communication ports: RS-232, Message formats: NMEA, LAN 100 Mbs BaseT Ethernet
- Radio module: Sensitivity Better than -115 dBm, Bandwidth: 25 kHz, Frequencies: 156.025 to 162.025 MHz, Default Ch. 87B (161.975 MHz), Default Ch. 88B (162.025 MHz)
- Environmental specifications: Service and redundancy, Operating temperature range: -15 to +55 ºC, Humidity: < 95 % relative, non-condensing, GPS antenna: 100 % hermetically sealed, VHF antenna: 100 % hermetically sealed
- Standards and regulations: Electrical safety EN 60950-1, Electromagnetic compatibility EN 60945/EN 61000-6-3/6-2, Electrical interface IEC 61162-1/2, IALA recommendation A-124, Radio IEC 61993-2 (clause 15), ITU-R M. 1371-5
- Weights and dimensions: AIS RX610 Unit: 3 kg, 44 mm x 485 mm x 345 mm, AIS RX610_24 V DC Unit: 3.3 kg, 44 mm x 485 mm x 345 mm, GPS antenna: 0.15 kg, 230 mm x 33 mm, VHF antenna: 1.0 kg, 1250 mm
- Power specifications: AIS RX610 Unit: 100 to 240 V AC (50 to 60 Hz), AIS RX610_24 V DC Unit: Optional combined 100 to 240 V AC and 24 V DC, Power consumption: 9 W average

General text: The MFD 307 PANEL COMPUTER, also known as the Multi Function Display (MFD 307) 7”, is a maritime 10 finger capacitive touch panel computer. This display is designed to be used with various Kongsberg navigation products that have a relevant application layer installed. Some navigation products are wheel marked and for these products, the display includes software that is type approved in line with a performance standard, having been tested and approved according to IEC 60945. The design of the MFD 307 allows for different mounting solutions such as panel mount (flush), flange mount, DIN rail mount, and RAM bracket mount. It is quick to install and easy to operate. Communication between the display and the relevant navigation equipment is achieved via Ethernet and/or serial line (RS-422), with the serial line support being an optional variant of the product. The MFD 7” is available as OEM with Linux installed as a platform for third party applications and products.
Features:
Key Features include: 
- 7” maritime 10 finger capacitive touch panel computer 
- Compatible with various Kongsberg navigation products 
- Type approved software for wheel marked products 
- Multiple mounting solutions 
- Quick installation and easy operation 
- Communication via Ethernet and/or serial line (RS-422) 
- Optional variant with serial line support 
- Available as OEM with Linux installed
Technical Specifications:
Interfaces: 
- Ethernet (RJ45) 
- RS422 (9 pin d-Sub), optional 
- USB, 4 connections 
- Grounding connector 
- Power, 2 pin Phoenix 
Environmental Specifications: 
- Operating temperature range: -20 to +55 °C 
- Enclosure protection: IP 66 in front with flush mount (designed for) 
- Enclosure material: Aluminium, Surtec surface treatment 
Mounting Methods: 
- Flushmount 
- RAM/bracket mount 
- DIN Mount 
- Flange for retrofit into holes of a variety of different displays 
Standards and Regulations: 
- IEC 60945 
- IEC 62288 (Wheel marked products) 
- RoHS compliant, ref EN 50581:2012 
- CE marked 
Weight and Dimensions: 
- 860 g, 119.5 x 201.5 x 65.5 
Power: 
- Voltage: 10.8 – 32 V DC 
- Max power consumption: 10 W

General text: The cNODE MiniS Full Ocean Depth Transponder is designed for acoustic positioning of subsea vehicles including ROVs, autonomous underwater vehicles, deep towed bodies, and manned research submarines. Built in a titanium, 11,500m depth rated housing, the transponder features a pressure balanced directional transducer and has been field proven in the Marianas Trench. The internal rechargeable Li-Ion battery provides an operational life of up to 5 days in high power, with a 6 second ping rate. It also allows for external 24V power from the vehicle to recharge the battery and extend operational time. The transponder is fully compatible with the HiPAP 102 & HiPAP 101 SSBL positioning systems operating with Cymbal, KONGSBERG’s wideband acoustic signal protocol.
Features:
- Full ocean depth low frequency transponder
 - Titanium, 11,500m depth rated housing
 - Pressure balanced directional transducer
 - Internal rechargeable Li-Ion battery with up to 5 days operational life
 - External 24V power recharge capability
 - Compatibility with HiPAP 102 & HiPAP 101 SSBL positioning systems
 - Field proven in the Marianas Trench
Technical Specifications:
Depth rating: 11,500m
Length x diameter: 418 x 206/110 mm
Weight in air/water: 20 / 15 kg
Housing: Titanium
Responder and beacon/pinger mode: Yes
Battery lifetime: Up to 420,000 replies
Standby time: 30 days
External power supply: 24 VDC/1 A
Operating temperature: -5°C to +55°C

General text: The new Kongsberg Sonar Mosaic software is an easy, universal real-time and post processing tool to generate georeferenced mosaic from the Kongsberg EA440 and Pulsar sidescan sonar data. It provides tagging of seabed features and generating georeferenced images of sonar data, as well as importing background data in ENC/IENC S57 standard, DXF format, and XTF format using an optional module. The software allows for simultaneous windows to show Mission view, Waterfall view, Map view, and Object/Target view, providing control of the sonar view, including range adjustment, gain control, and filter functions. It also enables saving and exporting georeferenced mosaic in TIF format, importing ENC/IENC, DXF, and geotiff background data, and generating HTML reports for exporting target data information with text and sonar image. The Sonar Mosaic software can be run on Windows 7 or higher, comes with an installer for building up the map database, and requires a dongle for software protection.
Features:
• Direct import of EA440 and Pulsar raw data. XTF import is anoptional feature
• Setup of different user settings and mission folder favorites for easyoperation
• Multi session capability
• Automatic filtering and elimination of positioning jumpsdue to lack of GNSS data (only in replay mode)
• Setting the Sonar Mosaic parameters, e.g. grid cell size
• Saving and exporting georeferenced mosaic in TIF format
• Importing ENC/IENC, DXF and geotiff background data
• Easy colour change in the Sonar Mosaic Map View(Grayscale, Copper, Bronze or other colours)
• Generating HTML reports for exporting target data informationwith text and sonar image
• View objects tagged in the Waterfall view Real timeSonar Mosaic Target view
Technical Specifications:
SONAR MOSAIC COMES AS A SOFTWARE PACKAGETHAT CAN BE RUN ON WINDOWS 7 OR HIGHER.
IN ADDITION TO THE SONAR MOSAIC PROGRAM,ANINSTALLER FOR BUILDING UP THE MAP DATABASE (ENC/IENC) WILL BE DELIVERED.
IMPORT OF XTF SIDESCAN DATA IS DONE VIA ANOPTIONAL MODULE.
THE SOFTWARE PROTECTION IS REALIZED BY MEANSOF A DONGLE.

kongsberg.com 01.SIS remote-1 of 2-26.05.21
SIS
REMOTE
SIS Remote
SIS Remote can handle several EM-systems at the same time. Each EM
connects to the same server and transmit data over the Internet, and SIS
Remote will combine the DTMs from all connected systems and display
them in the same Geographical view. The SIS Remote Operator will then
get a complete view of all DTMs from all survey launches.
Each EM will still be able to operate independently. This is useful when
the EM is being used in an autonomous vehicle: just let the AUV do the
job and log in to SIS Remote every now and then to monitor progress,
make adjustments, plan new lines etc. The full DTM from each boat will
be uploaded from ship-to-shore when SIS Remote connects.
The size of the DTM, even at highest Level of Detail, is typically less then
1% of the survey data (kmall-files).
The DTM in highest LoD will allow the Operator to see alignment issues
Ship-to-ship using SIS Remote
in the configuration, sound speed profile problems, “holes” in the dataset
etc. The full 3D view of SIS is also available in SIS Remote Geographical
window, allowing the operator to inspect the dataset in close detail.
The Planning module in SIS is also available in SIS Remote. Lines can be
planned in SIS Remote and transferred to the one of the connected survey
launches.
The Internet connection between from ship-to-shore can be any carrier
available: 4G/5G mobile network, WiFi, satellite, or KONGSBERG’s
Maritime Broadband Radio, the MBR.
Ship-to-shore using SIS Remote
SIS REMOTE
Bandwidth SIS 5 can make do with as little as 5kB/
sec. This allows the Digital Terrain Model,
DTM, to be transferred in highest Level of
Detail.
However, 30kB/sec will give a better user
experience as more quality information can
be transferred in real time.
Security SIS Remote needs an Internet connection to
work. This connection can either be secured
using the existing setup on the ship, or by
using KONGSBERG’s Global Secure Network,
GSN, which is a combination of HW and SW to
secure the communication from ship-to-shore.
Ship-to-cloud using SIS Remote
and Blue Insight
General text: KONGSBERG SYSTEMS Remote Operation of EM-systems With SIS Remote, operators can control KONGSBERG EM-systems from any device connected to the Internet without the need for extra training. The Installation- and Runtime-parameters, Sound Speed Profile handling, and the Digital Terrain Model in the Geographical Window remain consistent. SIS Remote can utilize the Customer’s existing private network for ship-to-shore communication, utilizing the security configuration already in place. KONGSBERG offers ship-to-cloud communication through a secured network, Global Secure Network, providing complete control of the EM-systems from anywhere and allowing access through any web-browser by secure login to a Virtual Machine (Windows PC) in KONGSBERG’s cloud solution Blue Insight. The standard version of SIS 5 has SIS Remote enabled, and through a feature in the license dongle, SIS 5 can be transformed into SIS Remote without the need for additional installation.
Features: - Operate KONGSBERG EM-systems from any device connected to the Internet - Utilize the Customer’s existing private network for ship-to-shore communication - Ship-to-cloud communication through Global Secure Network - Complete control of the EM-systems from anywhere - Access through any web-browser via secure login to a Virtual Machine (Windows PC) in KONGSBERG’s cloud solution Blue Insight - SIS 5 can be transformed into SIS Remote without the need for additional installation
Technical Specifications: Bandwidth: SIS 5 can operate with as little as 5kB/sec, allowing the transfer of Digital Terrain Model in highest Level of Detail. A better user experience can be achieved with 30kB/sec. Security: SIS Remote requires an Internet connection, which can be secured using the existing ship setup or through KONGSBERG’s Global Secure Network (GSN), ensuring secure communication from ship-to-shore. Ship-to-cloud communication is enabled through Blue Insight.

General text: Remote Operation of EM-systems With SIS Remote, operators can control KONGSBERG EM-systems from any device connected to the Internet. There is no need for additional training for operators familiar with SIS 5. SIS Remote offers the same Installation and Runtime parameters, Sound Speed Profile handling, and Digital Terrain Model in the Geographical Window as SIS 5. It can utilize the customer's existing private network for ship-to-shore communication, leveraging the security configuration that is already in place. In addition, KONGSBERG can facilitate ship-to-cloud communication through a secured network called the Global Secure Network, providing operators with access to SIS Remote via any web browser after a secure login to a Virtual Machine (Windows PC) in KONGSBERG’s cloud solution, Blue Insight. SIS Remote can also be configured for ship-to-ship operations, allowing control of survey launches and offering adjustable bandwidth for data transmission. It requires as little as 5kB/sec for reliable quality control and ensures the full transmission of the Digital Terrain Model ship-to-shore.
Features:
- Complete control of the EM-systems from anywhere
 - Installation and runtime parameters fully supported
 - Sound Speed Profile management
 - Adjustable bandwidth controlled from remote location
 - Needs as little as 5kB/sec to do reliable quality control
 - Digital Terrain Model in full detail always transmitted ship-to-shore
 - Capability to handle several EM-systems at the same time
 - Planning module available for line planning and transfer to connected survey launches
 - Compatible with various ship-to-shore communication methods including 4G/5G, WiFi, satellite, and KONGSBERG’s Maritime Broadband Radio (MBR)
 - Bandwidth allowance for optimal user experience
Technical Specifications:
- Bandwidth: SIS Remote can operate with as little as 5kB/sec, while 30kB/sec allows for a better user experience
 - Security: SIS Remote can utilize the existing ship setup or KONGSBERG’s Global Secure Network (GSN) for secure communication from ship-to-shore
 - Ship-to-cloud communication: SIS Remote provides access to Blue Insight through a secured network, allowing operators to use any web browser for remote access

be transferred in real time.
Security SIS Remote needs an Internet connection to
work. This connection can either be secured
using the existing setup on the ship, or by
using KONGSBERG’s Global Secure Network,
GSN, which is a combination of HW and SW to
secure the communication from ship-to-shore.
Ship-to-cloud using SIS Remote
and Blue Insight
General text: KONGSBERG SYSTEMS Remote Operation of EM-systems With SIS Remote you can operate the KONGSBERG EM-systems from any device connected to the Internet. Operators used to SIS 5 can also operate SIS Remote, no extra training is necessary. The Installation- and Runtime-parameters, Sound Speed Profile handling, the Digital Terrain Model in the Geographical Window are all the same. SIS Remote can use the Customer’s existing private network for communication ship-to-shore. The security configuration already in place will then be used for SIS Remote as well. KONGSBERG can also provide ship-to-cloud communication through a secured network, Global Secure Network, and then the operator can access SIS Remote through any web-browser by secure login to a Virtual Machine (Windows PC) in KONGSBERG’s cloud solution Blue Insight. SIS Remote can also be set up in a ship-to-ship configuration. The surveyor on the mothership can control one or more survey launches with EM and SIS 5. The standard version of SIS 5 has already SIS Remote enabled. Through a feature in the license dongle SIS 5 can be turned into SIS Remote. No extra installation is required. SIS Remote can handle several EM-systems at the same time. Each EM connects to the same server and transmits data over the Internet, and SIS Remote will combine the DTMs from all connected systems and display them in the same Geographical view. The Internet connection from ship-to-shore can be any carrier available: 4G/5G mobile network, WiFi, satellite, or KONGSBERG’s Maritime Broadband Radio, the MBR.
Features: - Complete control of the EM-systems from anywhere in the network - Installation and runtime parameters fully supported - Sound Speed Profile surveyor on the mothership can control one or more survey launches with EM and SIS 5 - Adjustable bandwidth, controlled from remote location: Choose how much data to transmit from ship-to-shore - Needs as little as 5kB/sec to do reliable quality control - Digital Terrain Model in full detail always transmitted ship-to-shore
Technical Specifications: Category: Bandwidth, Parameters: 5kB/sec or 30kB/sec, Parameter value: Allows the Digital Terrain Model to be transferred in highest Level of Detail. Category: Security, Parameters: Internet connection, Parameter value: Can either be secured using the existing setup on the ship, or by using KONGSBERG’s Global Secure Network, GSN, which is a combination of HW and SW to secure the communication from ship-to-shore.

General text: KONGSBERG introduces the DPS i-series, a fusion of years of experience in GNSS and inertial technology, to deliver a scalable and future-proof reference solution with a focus on operational efficiency for dynamic positioning (DP) applications. The DPS i4, part of the DPS i-series, utilizes data from all available GNSS constellations including GPS, GLONASS, Galileo, and BeiDou. It ensures increased operational efficiency by facilitating the operation with no additional reliable position reference solution. The integration of the latest multi-GNSS inertial technology and KONGSBERG’s motion gyro compass (MGC™) allows for a cost-efficient and scalable solution, adaptable to the specific requirements of any vessel.
Features:
- Multi-frequency GPS, GLONASS, BeiDou, Galileo, and SBAS receiver GNSS antenna
 - Highly optimized integration of INS and GNSS without the use of 3rd party DGNSS services
 - Dual frequency ionospheric compensation
 - INS aided RAIM capability for enhanced integrity and reliability
 - Fully capable to utilize differential correction services if required
 - High-precision lever arm compensation of position and velocity
 - Scalable solution
 - GNSS heading (requires two GPS systems)
 - Spoofing detection capabilities
 - Automatic data recording with replay functionality
 - Remote service and diagnostics by utilizing K-IMS

General text: The Maritime Broadband Radio is a smart antenna designed for use in any application where digital high-speed reliable communication and data transfer is crucial for efficient and safe operation. With only 85 grams, the MBR 144 UAV is tailored for lightweight UAVs, which require expanded operational range for command and control as well as a payload data link. The overall dimensions of the MBR 144 UAV makes it easy to integrate to many different UAVs with only power and Ethernet connection required. The antenna connections are connector-based, thus the antennas can be adjusted for the specific UAV design. The MBR Unit has a range of 85 g and dimensions of 120 x 65 x 13.3 mm. It supports user data transfer ranging from 1 to 15 Mbps. The antenna provides omni-directional 360 degrees azimuth coverage with a supply voltage of 5 V DC and a maximum power consumption of 25 W. The idle power consumption is 7 W. Its RF specifications include frequency band of 4900 MHz to 5900 MHz, channel bandwidth of 20 MHz, Tx power up to 2 W, antenna gain of 7 dBi, EIRP Max 40 dBm, and GMSK modulation. The MBR 144 UAV is equipped with 4 antenna connectors and 1 Ethernet/LAN interface. It is essential to note that specifications are subject to change without further notice.

Scraped Text:
RADIUS 600X
ATEX CERTIFIED FIXED POWER TRANSPONDER
The RADius 600X transponder is a part of the short-distance relative positioning system RADius,
developed for use in applications where the need for a robust and highly accurate relative
positioning system is crucial. RADius 600X is suitable for large installations like offshore platforms,
FPSOs and similar where DP operated vessels typically will approach the installation.
EX certified
The RADius 600X high gain transponder is an
intrinsically ATEX safe product (category 2) suitable to
be installed in hazardous locations where there may be
an explosive mixture of flammable gases belonging to gas
groups IIB and/or IIA. The transponder can be used in
hazardous zones 1 and 2. Temperature class is T4.
Fixed power
The RADius 600X is powered from a power supply located
in a safe (non-hazardous) location and an EX type approved
zener barrier is used to limit the delivered energy to the
hazardous location to a safe level. The barrier - located
in a safe area - will prevent any hazardous voltage
or excessive current from reaching the hazardous zone.
For long cable runs an alternative approved power
solution can be delivered. Contact Kongsberg Seatex for
more information.
Unique ID
The transponders are coded with unique IDs ensuring
reliable identification and tracking of vessels in
demanding environments. Several interrogators can
approach the same transponders, ensuring multi-user
capabilities. Up to five transponders can be tracked
simultaneously by the interrogator.

General text: The RADius 600X transponder is a crucial part of the RADius positioning system ideal for use in large installations such as offshore platforms and FPSOs. It is ATEX certified (category 2) for use in hazardous locations with explosive gas mixtures and can be deployed in zones 1 and 2. The transponder is powered from a safe location and features unique IDs for reliable vessel identification and multi-user tracking capabilities. Its high-performance environmental specifications, weights, and dimensions, as well as power specifications make it suitable for demanding environments. The system is compliant with the Radio Equipment Directive (RED) 2014/53/EU and holds the ATEX certificate no. PRESAFE 17 ATEX 10742X.
Features:
Key Features:
- ATEX certified for hazardous locations
- Powered from a safe location
- Unique IDs for reliable vessel identification
