General text: The Simrad 38-7 transducer is a 38 kHz single-beam transducer that incorporates 88 Tonpilz elements, offering a relatively narrow beam with substantial range capability. The order number for this transducer is KSV-082776. It has a resonant frequency of 38 kHz and a cable length of 20 m. The beamwidth is circular with a range of 7 deg ±1, and the cable diameter is 11 mm. The transducer has a directivity index of 28 ±1 dB and weighs 40 kg without the cable. It also has an equivalent two-way beam angle of -20.5 ±1 dB and a storage temperature range of -20 to 70 °C. With side lobes less than -15 dB and back radiation less than -35 dB, the transducer has a nominal impedance of 60 ohms with a maximum variation in |Z| of 45 - 80 ohms. The maximum variation in phase angle is ±30 deg, and the transmitting response is 185.5 dB ±2 re 1µPa per V. The open circuit receiving sensitivity is -170.5 dB ±2 re 1V per µPa. The electroacoustic efficiency ranges from a minimum of 0.50 to a maximum of 0.70, with a maximum input power of 4000 W and a maximum duty cycle at max. power of 1%. Its maximum transducer depth is 50 m.
Features:
- Incorporates 88 Tonpilz elements
 - Relatively narrow beam with substantial range capability
 - Circular beamwidth of 7 deg ±1
 - Directivity index of 28 ±1 dB
 - Weighs 40 kg without the cable
 - Nominal impedance of 60 ohms
 - Maximum input power of 4000 W
 - Maximum transducer depth of 50 m

Scraped Text:
RD301 User manual
Instruction manual
Remote display RD301
Digital depth repeater
RD301 User manual
INTRODUCTION
The RD301 remote display is made for use with the EA400/
EA600 and the EN 250 navigation echo sounder. It may also be
used with other echo sounders, if they have NMEA0183 output.
The RD301 is a depth repeater with alarm setting. The operator
may select alarm depth in the meny.
Maximum depth readings are 9999 m and a resolution of 0.1 m.
Brightness is adjusted on the front panel. Brightness can,
optionally, also be adjusted from a remote controller.
OPERATION
1. To switch the unit on: Press any key.
To switch the unit off: At the same time, press both the Up
and the Down key.
2. To adjust brigthness: Press the Up/Down keys to find suitable
setting.
3. To select depth alarm: Press the S key once and enter alarm setting
mode. The display shows “SetA“. Set the wanted depth by
using the Up and Down keys. When wanted alarm depth is
set, the unit will go back to normal mode operation after 15
seconds, or press S to the depth occur. When depth below
transducer become the same, or less, than the alarm depth,
the display will indicate “AL“ alternating with actual depth.
To set alarm off: Repeat operation number 3. and set alarm
depth to 0 m.
4. To select readings in feet, meters or fathoms: Press the S key
twice and enter alarm setting mode. The display shows “SetU “.
Select requested reading by pressing the Up or Down key. When
readings is set, the unit will go back to normal mode operation
after 15 sec, or press S to the depth occur.
5. To select transducer position (Only for EN 250): Press the S
key three times and enter the transducer selection mode. The dis-
play shows “SetP”. Press the Up/Down keys to select between
the four choices: Unknown, Forward, Backward or Auto.
- The Unknown selection decode any NMEA depth message and
shows the depth on the display. The position leds will then be
off.
- The other selections decode the NMEA message $PSKPDPT.
If Forward is selected, only the readings from the forward
transducer is shown, and if Backward is selected, only the
readings from the backward transducer is shown.
- The Auto selection switches between Forward, Backward
and Unknown depending on the NMEA messages available.
The led for positions will shift automatically and blink every
third second, indicating that the Auto selection is active. If
the transducer position is unknown, both leds will be on and
blinking.

General text: The RD301 remote display is designed for use with the EA400/EA600 and the EN 250 navigation echo sounder, with compatibility for other echo sounders that have NMEA0183 output. It functions as a depth repeater with alarm setting, allowing the operator to select alarm depth in the menu. The maximum depth readings are 9999 m with a resolution of 0.1 m. Brightness adjustment can be done on the front panel, with the option for remote adjustment. The user manual provides detailed instructions for operation, including switching the unit on and off, adjusting brightness, selecting depth alarm, choosing readings in feet, meters or fathoms, and selecting transducer position. Additionally, it includes guidance for NEMA input, panel mounting, environmental conditions, and wiring/connecting.
Features:
Key Features:
- Designed for use with EA400/EA600 and the EN 250 navigation echo sounder
- Functions as a depth repeater with alarm setting
- Maximum depth readings of 9999 m with 0.1 m resolution
- Adjust brightness on the front panel
- Compatibility for remote brightness adjustment
- Detailed instructions for operation

THE PROFESSIONAL GNSS TRACKING SOLUTION
The Seatrack 320 represents the state-of-the-art in relative GNSS tracking systems combined
with over 20 years of operational experience in extreme maritime environments. Utilizing the
latest in GNSS technology, the Seatrack 320 transponder is tailored to applications demanding a
high-end solution in reliability and accuracy. Seatrack 320 transmits data through serial interface
or UHF-radio.

SEADIFF 300
THE PROFESSIONAL GNSS TRACKING SOLUTION
The Seadiff 300 is a GPS based relative positioning system. Seadiff is the on board system for
calculation of data from connected Seatrack units. Seatrack units are connected to Seadiff either
via radio communication or wired connection and Seadiff provides typically relative range and
bearing to all units. Bearing between Seatracks can also be presented where relative or absolute
heading of an object is needed.

General text: Die Sonar Mosaic Software bietet eine einfache, universelle Echtzeit- und Auswerte-Werkzeug für die Generierung von georeferenzierten Mosaiken aus Kongsberg EA440 und Pulsar Sidescan Sonardaten. Mit dieser Software können Objekte am Meeresboden markiert und gespeichert werden, während die georeferenzierten Bilder im ENC/IENC S57 Standard und DXF Format abgespeichert werden. Darüber hinaus erweitert die Bandbreite der Kongsberg Sidescan Sonare um eine einfach zu nutzende Mosaic Software, die es den Nutzern ermöglicht, das volle Potenzial dieser Systeme auszuschöpfen. Weitere wesentliche Merkmale der Sonar Mosaic Software sind der Realtime-Import der EA440 und Pulsar Rohdaten, die Erstellung verschiedener Nutzerprofile und Favoritenordner für die Messdaten, sowie die Umfangreiche Auswahl der Mosaicing Parameter und das Speichern und Exportieren der georeferenzierten Mosaike im Tif - Format.
Features:
Real time Import der EA440 und Pulsar Rohdaten im XTFFormat oder im Rohdatenformat zur Auswertung beim Replay
Erstellung verschiedener Nutzerprofile, sowieFavoritenordner für die Messdaten
Multi Session Fähigkeit
Automatische Filterung und Eliminierung vonPositionssprüngen bei kurzem GNSS Ausfall
Umfangreiche Auswahl der Mosaicing Parameter, z.B Größeder Gridzellen, Farbe, Verstärkung, TVG Kurven, etc.
Speichern und exportieren der georeferenzierten Mosaikeim Tif - Format
Technical Specifications:
SONAR MOSAIC WIRD ALS SOFTWAREPAKET, LAUFFÄ-HIG UNTER WINDOWS 7 ODER HÖHER GELIEFERT.
ZUSÄTZLICH ZUM SONAR MOSAIC PROGRAMM WIRDAUCH EIN INSTALLATIONSPROGRAMM ZUM ERSTELLEN VON DATENBANKEN FÜR KARTEN (ENC/IENC) GELIEFERT.

DER SOFTWARESCHUTZ WIRD MITTELS EINESDONGELS REALISIERT.

General text: The DPS i6 by KONGSBERG is a sensor-fusioned GNSS solution specifically designed for dynamic positioning. It brings together KONGSBERG's extensive experience in GNSS and inertial technology to create a scalable and future-proof reference solution with a focus on operational efficiency for DP applications. The DPS i6 offers precise positioning and GNSS-based heading, making it suitable for the most challenging installations. It also ensures optimum tracking of multi-constellation satellite signals under all conditions due to its flexibility in the installation of dual GNSS antennas. The integration of the latest multi-GNSS technology with KONGSBERG’s unique motion gyro compass (MGC™) ensures high-quality performance without compromising on operational efficiency, making it a reliable and cost-efficient position reference solution. Additionally, it is prepared to utilize differential corrections, SBAS, and Galileo HAS services when required, further enhancing its operational efficiency.
Features:
Key Features:
- Multi-frequency GPS, GLONASS, Galileo, BeiDou, and SBAS receiver
- Highly optimized integration of INS and GNSS without the use of 3rd party DGNSS services
- Dual frequency ionospheric compensation GNSS antenna
- INS aided RAIM capability for enhanced integrity and reliability GNSS antenna
- Fully capable to utilize differential correction services if required
- High-precision lever arm compensation of position and velocity
- Intuitive and easy-to-use HMI tailored to safety critical DP HMI operations
- GNSS-based heading DPS
- Spoofing detection capabilities
- Automatic data recording with replay functionality
- Remote service and diagnostics by utilizing K-IMS
- Galileo High Accuracy Service (HAS) ready Gyro
- GPS L5 ready GNSS corrections
Technical Specifications:
Performance:
- Non-differential position accuracy: 0.65 m 95% CEP
- RTK accuracy: 1 cm + 1.6 ppm RMS
- High precision accuracy: < 10 cm, 95% CEP
- HAS precision accuracy: < 20 cm, 95% CEP
- DGNSS position accuracy: < 1 m, 95% CEP
- SBAS position accuracy: < 1 m, 95% CEP
- Velocity accuracy: < 0.01 m/s, 95% CEP
- Roll, pitch accuracy: MRU 5+: 0.007° RMS, MGC R2: 0.01° RMS, MGC R3: 0.007° RMS

Weights and Dimensions:
- DPS Processing Unit: 5.4 kg, 89 x 485 x 357 mm
- DPS HMI Unit: 3.6 kg, 44 x 481 x 267 mm
- GNSS antenna: 0.5 kg, 69 mm x 185 mm

Power Specifications:
- DPS Processing Unit: 100 - 240 V AC, 50/60 Hz, max 75 W
- DPS HMI Unit: 100 - 240 V AC, 50/60 Hz, max 170 W
- GNSS antenna: 5 V DC from Processing Unit

Environmental Specifications:
- Operating temperature range: DPS Processing Unit -15 to +55 ºC, DPS HMI Unit +5 to +35 ºC, GNSS antenna -40 to +85 ºC
- Humidity: DPS Processing Unit Max 95 % non-condensing, DPS HMI Unit Max 90 % non-condensing, GNSS antenna IP69K
- Vibration: IEC 60945/EN 60945, IACS E10
- Mechanical: Compliance to EMC, immunity/emission IEC 60945/EN 60945, IACS E10
- Standards used: ETSI EN 303 413 V1.2.1 (2021-04), ETSI EN 300 330 V2.1.1 (2017-02)

Interfaces:

- IMU: RS-422

- USB: 3

This fifth generation roll and pitch motion sensor is specially designed for use in marine applications and is the ideal
sensor for roll and pitch measurements on board ships.

pitch measurements within voyage recording, corresponding angular rate vectors fixed to the vehicle
dynamic positioning systems, fishing sonars and frame. The unit can in addition output surge and sway

and data presentation software. By configuring the unit
with the vector between the MRU and the vessel Center
of Gravity (CG), the MRU D will output accurate roll and

General text: The MRU D is a fifth-generation roll and pitch motion sensor designed for marine applications. It is specifically tailored for roll and pitch measurements on ships. The sensor is commonly used in voyage recording, dynamic positioning systems, fishing sonars, and telecommunication antenna systems. The unit outputs roll and pitch angles, corresponding angular rate vectors fixed to the vehicle frame, and can also output surge and sway accelerations. It is available with digital I/O protocols through both serial lines and Ethernet interface, allowing easy distribution of data to multiple users on board. The unit is delivered with a Windows-based configuration and data presentation software, and each unit comes with a Calibration Certificate stating that it is tested and found within the specifications. The MRU D is capable of outputting accurate roll and pitch measurements even when mounted high up in the ship, due to its ability to suppress the effect of horizontal acceleration on the roll and pitch performance. This feature makes it superior to inclinometers, pendulous devices, and standard Vertical Reference Units.
Features:
• 0.35° roll and pitch accuracy
• Outputs real-time roll and pitch measurements
• Suppression of horizontal acceleration when mounted off the vessel Center of Gravity (CG)
• Outputs on RS-232, RS-422, and Ethernet
• High output data rate (200 Hz)
• High reliability and no scheduled maintenance, no mechanical wear-out parts
• Small size, light weight, and low power consumption
• Each MRU delivered with Calibration Certificate
• Selectable communication protocols in the Windows based MRU configuration software
• Export license not required
• 2-year warranty

RADIUS 700
LONG RANGE BATTERY OPERATED TRANSPONDER
The RADius 700 transponder is a part of the short-distance relative positioning system RADius for
use in applications where the need for a robust and highly accurate relative positioning system is
crucial. RADius 700 has an operating range of up to 1000 metres.
Easy to deploy and operate
The RADius 700 transponder is easily deployed as the unit
runs on internal batteries, thus, no cable connection is
necessary. The replaceable internal Lithium battery has
an estimated life time of three years.
ON/OFF switching is easily done by inserting/removing the
activation plug at the back of the transponder. The operating
sector of the unit is 90° horizontally and vertically.
Unique ID
The transponders are coded with unique IDs ensuring
reliable identification and tracking in demanding
environments. Several interrogators can approach the
same transponders, ensuring multi-user capabilities. Up
to five transponders can be tracked simultaneously by the
interrogator. The transponder is suited with dip-switches
for easy setting of the transponder ID.

Scraped Text:
SEADIFF 300
THE PROFESSIONAL GNSS TRACKING SOLUTION
The Seadiff 300 is a GPS based relative positioning system. Seadiff is the on board system for
calculation of data from connected Seatrack units. Seatrack units are connected to Seadiff either
via radio communication or wired connection and Seadiff provides typically relative range and

General text: DPS 5D provides a superior solution to the most challenging installations. The unmatched all-in-one package addresses the extremes of accuracy and reliability. In addition to providing precise positioning, DPS 5D also offers precise GNSS based heading. The flexibility with regard to installation of the dual GNSS antennas ensures optimum tracking of multi-constellation satellite signals under all conditions. Designed to be trusted Trust and precision. DPS 5D is a position reference system especially developed for dynamically positioned (DP) vessels with a problematic possible accuracy by combining all available GNSS signals from two separate GNSS antennas and a multitude of differential correction data simultaneously. It supports RTK corrections, global high precision services, standard RTCM corrections and free-to-air services such as SBAS and IALA. In High Precision mode a worldwide accuracy of 10 to 20 cm is possible. RAIM (Receiver Autonomous Integrity Monitoring) extended by data from the IMU provides ultimate reliability of the position and velocity data under difficult GNSS conditions. A GNSS based heading solution is available. It can be presented on a display or as signal output to external equipment. The IMU integration provides a high accuracy heading solution and precise lever arm compensation.

The Maritime Broadband Radio is a smart antenna designed for use in any application where resilient high-speed
communication and high-capacity data transfer are crucial for efficient and safe operation. With beamforming the
MBR 179 provides steerable high-gain antenna direction in an omnidirectional sector, ideal for vessels and moving
assets. With narrow fan shaped antenna diagram, a strong link margin is maintained and continuously updated as the
unit is unaffected of vessel movements.

With beamforming, the MBR 179 provides steerable high-gain antenna direction in an omnidirectional sector, ideal for vessels and moving assets. This makes it an excellent choice for maritime communication where reliability is essential. General text:
THE EXTENDED TEMPERATURE MOTION SENSOR
The MRU E is a fifth-generation motion sensor designed for marine applications with an extended temperature range of -25 to +70 °C. It is suitable for use on open decks, inside cabinets, or on bulkheads. The sensor is typically used in a Helideck Monitoring System and meets HCA requirements to measure helideck acceleration and calculate Motion Severity Index (MSI). The MRU E is designed to output accurate and phase-free heave using the PFreeHeave algorithm, making it advantageous in long swell conditions and seabed mapping applications that can utilize a delayed heave signal. It accepts input of external speed and heading information and offers high reliability with its solid state sensors and proven electrical and mechanical construction. The output protocols for the MRU E are available on two individually configurable serial lines and Ethernet/UDP, enabling easy distribution of data to multiple users on board the vessel. The sensor also features a high output data rate of 200 Hz and comes with a 2-year warranty. It has a small size, light weight, and low power consumption, with no limitation in mounting orientation. The MRU E is produced and calibrated to perform accurately under ambient temperatures from -25 to +70 °C, utilizing three highly accurate accelerometers and three Micro-Electro-Mechanical-Structures (MEMS) angular rate gyros.
Features:
0.05° roll and pitch accuracy
Outputs real-time heave, roll, pitch, and linear acceleration measurements
Outputs on RS-232, RS-422, and Ethernet
High output data rate (200 Hz)
Each MRU delivered with Calibration Certificate
No limitation in mounting orientation
Lever arm compensation to two individually configurable monitoring points
Meets HCA requirements
Small size, light weight, and low power consumption
Selectable communication protocols in the Windows-based MRU configuration software
2-year warranty

Scraped Text:
RADIUS 700X
EX CERTIFIED BATTERY OPERATED TRANSPONDER
The RADius 700X transponder is a part of the short-distance relative positioning system RADius,
developed for use in applications where the need for a robust and highly accurate relative
positioning system is crucial. RADius 700X is suitable for large installations like offshore platforms,
FPSOs and similar where DP operated vessels typically will approach the installation, and where
ATEX certification is required.
EX certified
The RADius 700X transponder is an intrinsically ATEX
safe product (category 2) suitable to be installed in
hazardous locations where there may be an explosive
mixture of flammable gases belonging to gas groups IIB
and/or IIA. The transponder can be used in hazardous
zones 1 and 2. IECEx classification is Ex ib IIB T4 Gb.
Battery powered
The RADius 700X is powered from an intrinsically safe
encapsulated battery with an integral current limiting
resistor and has no wired connection to external
equipment.
Unique ID
The transponders are coded with unique IDs ensuring
reliable identification and tracking of vessels in
demanding environments. Several interrogators can
approach the same transponders, ensuring multi-user
capabilities. Up to five transponders can be tracked
simultaneously by the interrogator. The transponder
is suited with dip switches for easy setting of the
transponder ID.

General text: The RADius 700X transponder is a crucial component of the RADius short-distance relative positioning system, providing robust and highly accurate relative positioning. It is particularly suitable for large installations such as offshore platforms and FPSOs, where ATEX certification is required. The transponder is EX certified and battery-powered, ensuring safe and reliable performance in hazardous locations with explosive gas mixtures. The unique IDs coded into the transponders allow for reliable vessel identification and tracking, with multi-user capabilities. Additionally, the transponder is equipped with dip switches for easy setting of the transponder ID.

SEADIFF 320
THE PROFESSIONAL GNSS TRACKING SOLUTION
The Seadiff 320 is a GPS and Glonass based relative positioning system. Seadiff is the on board
system for calculation of data from connected Seatrack units. Seatrack units are connected to
Seadiff either via radio communication or wired connection and Seadiff provides typically relative
range and bearing to all units. Bearing between Seatracks can also be presented where relative or
absolute heading of an object is needed.

3710 DGNSS RECEIVER
DGNSS RECEIVER
The 3710 DGNSS Receiver is a high-performance DGNSS receiver capable of receiving
augmentation data from the Fugro Satellite Positioning worldwide DGNSS Service. The Fugro
service is a full-time differential GNSS (DGNSS) broadcast system delivering differential
corrections from an array of GNSS reference stations located around the globe. These services
include independent sub-decimetre level services (Fugro Seastar G4/G2 and Fugro Seastar XP2),
centimetre level services (Fugro Seastar G2+/G4+) and sub-metre level services (Fugro Seastar
StdL1).

differential corrections is vital for an efficient operation. algorithms and true parallel processing of up to two

internet and satellites simultaneously. It has the unique (NTRIP format) simultaneously. DGNSS corrections
capability of simultaneously receiving and outputting from different sources are combined by the unique
data from up to three sources (two satellite links and one multiplexing capability.
internet link). The signals are received via the DGNSS
antenna and by internet. After selection of the desired
broadcast source, the signals are made available as

General text: The 3710 DGNSS Receiver is a high-performance DGNSS receiver capable of receiving augmentation data from the Fugro Satellite Positioning worldwide DGNSS Service. The Fugro service offers differential corrections from a network of GNSS reference stations globally, providing a range of services including independent sub-decimetre level, centimetre level, and sub-metre level services. The receiver provides enhanced availability DGNSS processing, ensuring unmatched availability in challenging environments. It comprises a software-defined radio (SDR) signal processing core with advanced algorithms and true parallel processing of up to two differential corrections. Additionally, the receiver offers the unique capability of simultaneously receiving and outputting data from up to three sources, namely two satellite links and one internet link, allowing for combined corrections from different sources through multiplexing. The receiver also features easy software updates via USB, integrated 2-line LCD display, keypad for system configuration, and status, ethernet and serial interfaces, along with configurable output for external interfaces. The physical dimensions and environmental specifications of the receiver and DGNSS antenna are provided, including weights, dimensions, enclosure material, operating and storage temperature, humidity, ingress protection, power requirements, external interfaces, data outputs, message format, message type, radio frequencies, and compliance to safety standards.

• Capable of receiving augmentation data from the Fugro Satellite Positioning worldwide DGNSS Service
• Offers independent sub-decimetre level, centimetre level, and sub-metre level services
• Enhanced availability DGNSS processing
• Simultaneously receives and outputs data from up to three sources
• Easy software updates via USB
• Integrated 2-line LCD display and keypad
• Configurable output for external interfaces
• Ethernet and serial interfaces
• Multiplexing capability for combined corrections from different sources

MBR 179 MK2 PORTABLE
MARITIME BROADBAND RADIO
The MBR 179 MK2 Portable is a kit consisting of a MBR 179 MK2 radio, tripod and cables for quick
deployment. The MBR Portable is delivered in two transportation hard cases and is perfect to
use both on shore and on vessels which requires quick deployment for temporary operation. The Maritime Broadband
Radio is a smart antenna designed for use in any application where resilient high-speed communication and high-
capacity data transfer are crucial for efficient and safe operation. With beamforming the MBR 179 provides steerable
high-gain antenna direction in an omnidirectional sector, ideal for vessels and moving assets. With narrow fan shaped
antenna diagram, a strong link margin is maintained and continuously updated as the unit is unaffected of vessel
movements.

datasheet_name: The product name and header in the provided text is "MRU H".
General text: The MRU H is a versatile heave compensator designed for motion measurements in marine applications requiring highly accurate heave measurements in environments with extreme horizontal accelerations. It is specially designed for heave compensation applications and is suitable for roll, pitch and heave compensation of offshore cranes and echo sounders. Additionally, it can be used for ship motion monitoring applications such as helideck motion monitoring, hydroacoustic positioning systems, and hull stress monitoring. The MRU H incorporates three highly accurate accelerometers and three Micro-Electro-Mechanical-Structures (MEMS) angular rate gyros, achieving high reliability by using solid state sensors with no rotational or mechanical wear-out parts. It is delivered with Windows based configuration and data presentation software, and accepts input of external speed and heading information for improved accuracy in heave, roll and pitch during turns and accelerations. The MRU H outputs roll, pitch and heave measurements along with position, velocity, and accelerations in adjustable frames, making it ideal for various marine applications. The PFreeHeave algorithm used by the MRU H has an advantage in long swell conditions and for applications that can utilize a delayed heave signal, typical in seabed mapping applications.
Features:
• 0.05° roll and pitch accuracy

Scraped Text:
RADIUS 800X
EX CERTIFIED FIXED POWER TRANSPONDER
The RADius 800X transponder is a part of the short-distance relative positioning system RADius,
developed for use in applications where the need for a robust and highly accurate relative
positioning system is crucial. The system comprises an interrogator, installed on a vessel,
operating in the 5.5 GHz band and transponders which are deployed on the target. The RADius
800X has an operating range of up to 1000 metres, and is suitable for fixed installations on typical
a platform or an FPSO.
The main parts of the RADius 800X transponder
equipment are:

• The transponder consisting of the transponderelectronic unit located behind a plastic cover (cover
transparent to radio frequency used - 5.5 to 5.6
GHz), and the connection box with terminals for
the DC voltage cable and a DIP switch for setting the
Transponder Identification code.

• The Field Power Unit, with the intrinsically safe DC/DCPSD1004 power supply, located in the proximity of the
transponder equipment.

• The safe area equipment: The Phoenix QUINT AC/DCpower supply and the PSD1001C DC/DC barrier and
power supply.
ATEX certification
ATEX category 2 G product, gas group II B, temperature
class T4, specified ambient temperature rating -20 °C to
+60 °C.
Unique ID
The transponders are coded with unique IDs ensuring
reliable identification and tracking of vessels in
demanding environments. Several interrogators can
approach the same transponders, ensuring multi-user
capabilities. Up to five transponders can be tracked
simultaneously by the interrogator.

The system comprises an interrogator, installed on a vessel, operating in the 5.5 GHz band and transponders which are deployed on the target. The RADius 800X has an operating range of up to 1000 metres, and is suitable for fixed installations on typical a platform or an FPSO. SEADIFF 380
THE PROFESSIONAL GNSS TRACKING SOLUTION
The Seadiff 380 is a GPS, Glonass, Galileo and Beidou based relative positioning system. Seadiff
is the on board system for calculation of data from connected Seatrack units. Seatrack units are
connected to Seadiff either via radio communication or wired connection and Seadiff provides
typically relative range and bearing to all units. Bearing between Seatracks can also be presented
where relative or absolute heading of an object is needed.

MBR 189 MK2
MARITIME BROADBAND RADIO
The Maritime Broadband Radio is a smart antenna designed for use in any application where resilient high-
speed communication and high-capacity data transfer are crucial for efficient and safe operation. With real-time
beamforming, the MBR 189 adjusts the antenna direction for every IP datagram transmitted within a sector of 100°
x 100°. This operational sector can be increased by mounting multiple radios together, giving up to 360° azimuth
coverage. The MBR 189 is suitable for maritime land-to-sea communication and for ground stations for manned and
unmanned aircraft operations.

General text: The Maritime Broadband Radio is a smart antenna designed for use in any application where resilient high-speed communication and high-capacity data transfer are crucial for efficient and safe operation. With real-time beamforming, the MBR 189 adjusts the antenna direction for every IP datagram transmitted within a sector of 100° x 100°. This operational sector can be increased by mounting multiple radios together, giving up to 360° azimuth coverage. The MBR 189 is suitable for maritime land-to-sea communication and for ground stations for manned and unmanned aircraft operations. The operational range is dependent on antenna placement and height, offering a range of up to 50 km. The user data speed ranges from 0.7 to 16.5 Mbps, ensuring efficient and high-capacity data transfer. The MBR 189 has an ingress protection rating of IP66, ensuring durability in harsh environmental conditions. It is compliant with standards and regulations such as RED directive 2014/53/EU, EMC ETSI EN 301 843-1, ETSI EN 301 843-7, IEC 60945/EN 60945, ETSI EN 303 276, IEC 61010-1/EN 61010-1, IEC 60945/EN 60945, DNVGL-CG-0339, and IACS E10 (48 V DC), ensuring reliability and safety. The MBR unit weighs 8.8 kg and has dimensions of 323 x 323 x 111 mm, offering a compact and manageable design.

 - Operational sector coverage of up to 360° azimuth

 - Ingress protection rating of IP66

The MRU S roll, pitch and heave motion sensor is specially designed for fish finding equipment.

The MRU S model is typically used for real-time roll, The MRU S outputs roll, pitch and heave, together with
pitch and heave compensation of fishery sonars and linear acceleration and angular rate.
echosounders. In rough weather conditions the MRU
S provides vessel motion data to the fish finding Digital I/O protocols
equipment to present a display free from wave motion MRU data is available through both Ethernet interface
due to vessel rolling, pitching and heaving. and serial lines enabling easy distribution of MRU data
to multiple users on board the vessel. Output protocols
Function for commonly used sonar equipment are available
This cost-effective MRU S model incorporates 3-axis on two individually configurable serial lines and
Micro-Electro-Mechanical-System (MEMS) sensors Ethernet/UDP.
for both linear acceleration and angular rate. This unit
achieves high reliability by using solid state sensors
with no rotational or mechanical wear-out parts.
The unit is delivered with a Windows based
configuration and data presentation software. In this
software vector arms from where the MRU is mounted
to the centre of gravity (CG) and to two individually
configurable monitoring points (MPs), can be defined.
The heave measurement can be output in four
different locations (the MRU itself, CG, MP1 and MP2)
simultanously on the same serial line or Ethernet port.

General text: The MRU S roll, pitch and heave motion sensor is a cost-effective model specially designed for fish finding equipment. It is typically used for real-time roll, pitch and heave compensation of fishery sonars and echosounders. In rough weather conditions, the MRU S provides vessel motion data to the fish finding equipment to present a display free from wave motion due to vessel rolling, pitching, and heaving. The MRU S outputs roll, pitch and heave, together with linear acceleration and angular rate information. It incorporates 3-axis Micro-Electro-Mechanical-System (MEMS) sensors for high reliability and solid state sensors with no rotational or mechanical wear-out parts. The unit is delivered with a Windows-based configuration and data presentation software, enabling easy distribution of MRU data to multiple users on board the vessel.
Features:
• 0.3° roll and pitch accuracy
• Outputs real-time roll, pitch and heave measurements
• Outputs on RS-232, RS-422 and Ethernet
• High output data rate (200 Hz)
• Lever arm compensation to two individually configurable monitoring points
• Small size, light weight and low power consumption
• Each MRU delivered with Calibration Certificate
• Selectable communication protocols in the Windows based MRU configuration software
• Export license not required
• 2-year warranty

General text:
The RADius replacement battery pack for RADius 550X and RADius 700X transponders consists of a primary cell and a series resistor and is non-rechargeable. The battery pack is intrinsically safe. The cell with its infallible resistor is completely moulded inside a stainless steel container. For use and instructions of the battery pack, refer to the RADius 550X and RADius 700X Instruction Manuals.

The battery build-up offers a storage time of over 10 years at temperatures below +30 °C. The supplier model number is Xeno Energy XL205F/T1. The chemistry is Thionylchloride with a self-discharge rate of 1 to 2% per year at room temperature. The primary D cell's lithium metal content is 4.8 g, with a storage short-term range of +5 °C to +40 °C and a recommended long-term storage below +30 °C.

The electrical specifications include a no-load voltage of max 3.67 V, infallible integrated current limiting resistor of 390 R, max output current of 10.1 mA, and available power from pack max 39.4 mW. The capacity is 19 Ah, and the battery is non-rechargeable. The ATEX, IECEx and INMETRO certificates are also part of the specifications.

General text: DPS 112 is a robust and reliable DGNSS (DGPS/DGLONASS) sensor suitable for a wide range of marine applications. It utilises the Seastar G2 service capable of world wide decimeter accuracy. The Kongsberg Seatex award-winning DPS product line is well-proven and in use by professional marine and offshore users worldwide. The primary advantage of a combined GPS and GLONASS system is the increased satellite coverage, enhancing system availability and performance of DPS 112 compared to traditional DGPS systems in obstructed environments and under challenging signal tracking conditions. DPS 112 is a cost-efficient DGNSS solution designed for users where availability and reliability are paramount, with meter-level position accuracy and the possibility of achieving decimeter accuracy with the Fugro Seastar G2 service. It has a built-in display for easy system configuration and status monitoring, and an external display unit tailored for DP operations. The sensor utilizes regional SBAS services such as WAAS, EGNOS, GAGAN, MSAS, and local DGPS services like IALA DGPS. It can also utilize the Fugro Seastar G2 service, providing consistent decimeter-level accuracy positioning with 'orbit and clock' corrections of global validity.
Features:
• Combined GPS L1/L2, GLONASS L1/L2 and SBAS receiver
• IALA beacon capability
• Built-in L-band receiver with Fugro Seastar G2 capability
• Optional standard RTCM correction input
• Easy software updates via USB
• Ethernet interface
• Embedded keypad and display
• Configurable output for external interfaces
• External display unit (optional)
• DPS Display Unit (optional)
Technical Specifications: Seastar G2 service, DGPS/DGLONASS accuracy, SBAS accuracy, Velocity accuracy, Output rate, Performance Weight and Dimensions, Power Specifications, Interfaces, Data Outputs, Data Inputs, Environmental Specifications, Mechanical Vibration, Electromagnetic Compatibility, Product Safety

MBR 189 MK2 PORTABLE
MARITIME BROADBAND RADIO
The MBR 189 MK2 Portable is a kit consisting of a MBR 189 MK2 radio, tripod and cables for quick
deployment. The MBR Portable is delivered in two transportation hard cases and is perfect to use both on shore
and on vessels which requires quick deployment for temporary operation. The Maritime Broadband Radio is a smart
antenna designed for use in any application where resilient high-speed communication and high-capacity data
transfer are crucial for efficient and safe operation. With real-time beamforming, the MBR 189 adjusts the antenna
direction for every IP datagram transmitted within a sector of 100° x 100°. This operational sector can be increased by
mounting multiple radios together, giving up to 360° azimuth coverage. The MBR 189 is suitable for maritime land-to-
sea communication and for ground stations for manned and unmanned aircraft operations.

MGC maintenance &
recalibration
When to service the MGC
The MGC (Motion Sensor & Gyro Compass) is maintenance free when operated as an IMO type approved gyro
compass and no field maintenance is required. However, if the MGC is used as a roll and pitch sensor in addition
to being a heading device, the need for a recalibration of the MGC should be considered. This is based on the use
and operation mode of the sensor unit.
Recalibration The table shows an estimate of the total static attitude
The need for recalibration of the MGC sensor unit depends accuracy over time. The ”L” in the table is the latitude.
on the application and the operation mode which the unit has
been set up to operate in. MGC R3 unaided
2 years 4 years 6 years

• AHRS modeIn this mode input of speed and latitude is required to
Roll/pitch 0.01° 0.02° 0.03°
obtain full accuracy. For speed input NMEA VTG or VBW
can be used. For position input NMEA GLL or GGA can be
used. External time input, NMEA ZDA, is also required to 1/cos(L)*0.08° 1/cos(L)*0.08°
correctly time tag alerts from the gyro compass. In this Heading 1/cos(L)*0.08° +abs(tan(L)*0.02°) +abs(tan(L)*0.03°)
mode the sensor unit will output accurate heading, roll,
pitch and heave. The accuracy is within the specifications.
This is the default mode for the sensor unit.

• Inertial navigation modeMGC R2 unaided
In this mode input of latitude, longitude, height and time
from a GNSS receiver, is required. Input of NMEA VTG, 2 years 4 years 6 years
GGA and ZDA at 1 Hz rate is required. This mode requires
that the MGC is time synchronized with the external input Roll/pitch 0.02° 0.05° 0.09°
source by a PPS signal from the GNSS receiver or by using
an NTP server. In this mode the sensor unit will output
1/cos(L)*0.15° 1/cos(L)*0.15°
accurate heading, roll, pitch, heave, position and velocity. Heading 1/cos(L)*0.15° +abs(tan(L)*0.05°) +abs(tan(L)*0.09°)
The accuracy is within the specifications.
No recalibration is necessary if the sensor unit is operated
in inertial navigation mode. When operating in inertial
navigation mode, the sensor unit will calculate the drift in the
accelerometers over time and correct for its influence.
If the sensor unit is not operated in inertial navigation mode,
the accelerometer bias drift is not calculated. This will mainly
result in a possible static roll/pitch error. The heading accuracy
will not be significantly affected, except at high latitudes.
kongsberg.com
VALIDITY OF MGC CALIBRATION CERTIFICATE
An individual Calibration Certificate is generated for each
manufactured MGC. The certificate confirms performance for
the MGC compared with test requirements valid for the specific
type of MGC. The calibration date is printed on the Calibration
Certificate. The certificate does not include an expiry date as the
MGC will still be working even if there has been a long time since
the last calibration. However, the uncertainty whether the MGC
is within its specifications, will increase over the years without a
recalibration.
A recalibration of the MGC is recommended due to changes
in the characteristics of the internal sensors over time, and
is therefore necessary in order to achieve the specified
performance. Exactly when a recalibration is required, will depend
on the user application (use of the unit, i.e. thermal cycling,
vibration and shock).
MGC dispatch procedure
If a recalibration of an MGC is required, please follow these steps
to ensure an efficient and smooth recalibration process:
1. Contact the Customer Support departement at Kongsberg 2. Fill out the RMA with the MGC serial number (s/n) and return
Discovery by phone to +47 33 03 24 07 or by e-mail to the RMA to Customer Support.
km.support.seatex@km.kongsberg.com and ask for an RMA
(Return Material Authorization). If you need a spare MGC 3. You will receive an RMA number. Please attach the RMA to
during recalibration, please ask for a quote. the MGC shipment.
MGC recalibration turnaround time

• In general, the turnaround time for a complete service ofMGC units are four weeks after reception.

• Within five days after the arrival of an MGC, the unit has gonethrough an initial inspection.

• The calibration may uncover the need for service that doesnot appear during static testing on arrival and thus delays
should be expected. The unit must then undergo service
followed by a new calibration cycle. The delivery time will be
extended accordingly.

General text: MGC maintenance & recalibration When to service the MGC The MGC (Motion Sensor & Gyro Compass) is maintenance free when operated as an IMO type approved gyro compass and no field maintenance is required. However, if the MGC is used as a roll and pitch sensor in addition to being a heading device, the need for a recalibration of the MGC should be considered. This is based on the use and operation mode of the sensor unit. Recalibration The table shows an estimate of the total static attitude accuracy over time. The ”L” in the table is the latitude. The need for recalibration of the MGC sensor unit depends on the application and the operation mode which the unit has been set up to operate in. AHRS modeIn this mode input of speed and latitude is required to obtain full accuracy. For speed input NMEA VTG or VBW can be used. For position input NMEA GLL or GGA can be used. External time input, NMEA ZDA, is also required to correctly time tag alerts from the gyro compass. In this mode the sensor unit will output accurate heading, roll, pitch and heave. The accuracy is within the specifications. This is the default mode for the sensor unit. Inertial navigation modeIn this mode input of latitude, longitude, height and time from a GNSS receiver, is required. Input of NMEA VTG, GGA and ZDA at 1 Hz rate is required. This mode requires that the MGC is time synchronized with the external input source by a PPS signal from the GNSS receiver or by using an NTP server. In this mode the sensor unit will output accurate heading, roll, pitch, heave, position and velocity. The accuracy is within the specifications. No recalibration is necessary if the sensor unit is operated in inertial navigation mode. When operating in inertial navigation mode, the sensor unit will calculate the drift in the accelerometers over time and correct for its influence. If the sensor unit is not operated in inertial navigation mode, the accelerometer bias drift is not calculated. This will mainly result in a possible static roll/pitch error. The heading accuracy will not be significantly affected, except at high latitudes. VALIDITY OF MGC CALIBRATION CERTIFICATE An individual Calibration Certificate is generated for each manufactured MGC. The certificate confirms performance for the MGC compared with test requirements valid for the specific type of MGC. The calibration date is printed on the Calibration Certificate. The certificate does not include an expiry date as the MGC will still be working even if there has been a long time since the last calibration. However, the uncertainty whether the MGC is within its specifications, will increase over the years without a recalibration. A recalibration of the MGC is recommended due to changes in the characteristics of the internal sensors over time, and is therefore necessary in order to achieve the specified performance. Exactly when a recalibration is required, will depend on the user application (use of the unit, i.e. thermal cycling, vibration and shock). MGC dispatch procedure If a recalibration of an MGC is required, please follow these steps to ensure an efficient and smooth recalibration process: Contact the Customer Support departement at Kongsberg Discovery by phone to +47 33 03 24 07 or by e-mail to km.support.seatex@km.kongsberg.com and ask for an RMA (Return Material Authorization). If you need a spare MGC during recalibration, please ask for a quote. You will receive an RMA number. Please attach the RMA to the MGC shipment. MGC recalibration turnaround time In general, the turnaround time for a complete service of MGC units are four weeks after reception. Within five days after the arrival of an MGC, the unit has gone through an initial inspection. The calibration may uncover the need for service that does not appear during static testing on arrival and thus delays should be expected. The unit must then undergo service followed by a new calibration cycle. The delivery time will be extended accordingly. Specifications subject to change without any further notice.
Features: - Maintenance-free operation as an IMO type approved gyro compass - Recalibration required if used as a roll and pitch sensor in addition to a heading device - AHRS mode: accurate output of heading, roll, pitch, and heave with required speed and latitude input - Inertial navigation mode: accurate output of heading, roll, pitch, heave, position, and velocity with required input from GNSS receiver - Validation of MGC calibration certificate without an expiry date - Recommended recalibration for achieving specified performance based on changes in internal sensors' characteristics - Dispatch procedure for efficient recalibration process - Recalibration turnaround time: four weeks after reception
Technical Specifications: MGC: Maintenance free when operated as an IMO type approved gyro compass, recalibration required if used as a roll and pitch sensor in addition to a heading device. AHRS mode: accurate output of heading, roll, pitch, and heave with required speed and latitude input. Inertial navigation mode: accurate output of heading, roll, pitch, heave, position, and velocity with required input from GNSS receiver. Validation of MGC calibration certificate without an expiry date. Recalibration recommended for achieving specified performance based on changes in internal sensors' characteristics. Dispatch procedure for efficient recalibration process. Recalibration turnaround time: four weeks after reception.

General text:
Introduction
The Simrad 200-28E is a 200 kHz single-beam transducer protected in a robust housing. The solid interior is void of air pockets or expanded foam enabling it to withstand the pressure at a depth of 1000 m. It has an order number of KSV-109178. The transducer has a resonant frequency of 200 kHz and an electroacoustic efficiency of 70 ±20%. Its circular beamwidth is 7 deg. ±1 deg. with a maximum input power of 1500 W. The directivity index is 28.5 dB and the maximum duty cycle (at maximum power) is 4%. The equivalent two-way beam angle (ψ) is -21 dB, and the maximum installation depth is 1000 m re 1 steradian. The transducer has a cable length of 25 m and a cable diameter of 10.9 mm. Its weight without cable is 3.4 kg. The transmitting response is 180.0 ±2 dB re 1µPa per V, and the receiving sensitivity (open circuit) is -185.0 ±2 dB re 1V per µPa.

General text: The DPS 114 is a robust and reliable DGNSS (DGPS/DGLONASS) sensor suitable for a wide range of marine applications. It utilizes the Seastar G4 service capable of world wide decimeter accuracy. The DPS 114 is a member of the DPS Family GNSS Infrastructure, which is developed and suitable for all applications in need for a confident position solution when operating in safety-critical environments. The DPS 114 uses regional SBAS services such as WAAS, EGNOS, GAGAN and MSAS, and local DGPS services such as IALA DGPS. Additionally, it can utilize the Fugro Seastar G4 service provided by Fugro’s own network of dual system reference stations, offering consistent decimetre level accuracy positioning with ‘orbit and clock’ corrections with a global validity. The DPS 114 has a built-in display for easy system configuration and status monitoring, and an external display unit with an intuitive and easy-to-use graphical interface tailored for DP operations is available, making it an ideal solution for workboats and platform support vessels.
Features: Key Features: - Multi-frequency GPS, GLONASS, Galileo, Beidouand SBAS receiver - IALA beacon capability - Built-in L-band receiver with Fugro Seastar G4 capability - Optional standard RTCM correction input - Easy software updates via USB - Ethernet interface DPS 114ESC ENTER - Embedded keypad and display - Configurable output for external interfaces - External display unit (optional) RTCM corrections
Technical Specifications: Technical Specifications: PERFORMANCE - Seastar G4 service: 10 cm, 95 % CEP - DGPS/DGLONASS accuracy: < 1 m, 95 % CEP - SBAS accuracy: < 1 m, 95 % CEP - Velocity accuracy: < 0.05 m/s, 95 % CEP - Output rate: 1 Hz WEIGHT AND DIMENSIONS - DPS 114 unit: 5.8 kg, 89 mm x 444 mm x 357 mm - GNSS antenna: 0.5 kg, 69 mm x 185 mm - IALA antenna: 0.78 kg, 870 mm - Spotbeam antenna: 1.4 kg, 96 mm x 150 mm POWER SPECIFICATIONS - DPS 114 unit: 100 - 240 V AC 50/60 Hz, max 60 W - GNSS antenna: 5 V DC from processing unit - IALA antenna: 10.2 V DC from processing unit - Spotbeam antenna: 12 V DC from processing unit INTERFACES - Serial ports: 3 serial ports (2 NMEA output, 1 RTCM input), RS-232 or RS-422 (galvanically isolated) - Ethernet/LAN: 1 - USB: 3 ENVIRONMENTAL SPECIFICATIONS - Operating temperature range: DPS 114 unit -15 to +55 °C*, GNSS antenna -40 to +85 °C, IALA antenna -55 to +70 °C, Spotbeam antenna -30 to +70 °C *) Recommended +5 to +40 °C - Humidity: Max. 95 % non-condensing

MARITIME BROADBAND RADIO
The Maritime Broadband Radio is a smart antenna designed for use in maritime applications where digital high-speed
reliable communication and data transfer is crucial for efficient and safe operations. Completely enclosed with
integrated antennas the MBR 144 is designed for installations on small manned and unmanned vessels. The unit has
an integrated bracket for easy installation on vertical or horizontal rails, and with built-in GNSS sensor, the unit has
possibility for absolute positioning. With its neat and slim design, and only one cable to connect, the MBR 144 is easy
to deploy on the vessel.

datasheet_name: I don't see a specific product name or header in the text you've provided. If you have a specific name in mind or need help with something else, please feel free to ask!
General text: The 200-3G transducer is designed for shallow water and coastal survey applications where high frequency and narrow beam width are required. The narrow 3° beam and low side lobes result in high precision survey. It has a minimal sidelobes and concentrated energy on target, providing excellent definition. The transducer features a robust, stainless steel housing with a threaded stem that simplifies attaching to steel housing, making it easy to mount. With a power rating of 3 kW at 2% duty cycle, resonant frequency at 200 kHz, and impedance of 60 Ohms, this transducer is ideal for high precision survey applications. It comes with a 15m cable, operates within a temperature range of -6 to +48 °C, and has a storage temperature of -20 to +70 °C.
Features: • Ideal for high precision survey applications • Minimal sidelobes and concentrated energy on target providing excellent definition • Robust, stainless steel housing with threaded stem for easy mounting • Power rating: 3 kW @ 2% duty cycle • Resonant frequency: 200 kHz • Impedance: 60 Ohms • 15m cable included • Operating temperature: -6 to +48 °C • Storage temperature: -20 to +70 °C
Technical Specifications: Category: Hydrographic Transducer Parameters: Power rating, Resonant frequency, Impedance, Cable length, Operating temperature, Storage temperature Parameter Value: 3 kW @ 2% duty cycle, 200 kHz, 60 Ohms, 15m, -6 to +48 °C, -20 to +70 °C

MBR 144 OEM is the low weight, compact version in the MBR family. Designed for customer specific integration, with a flexible form for easy fit into existing platforms. The MBR unit weighs 260 g (excl. cables and antennas) and has dimensions of 120 x 78 x 35 mm. It operates within an environmental temperature range of -30 °C to +55 °C with an ingress protection rating of IP41. The MBR ensures reliable communication and data transfer in maritime applications, contributing to operational efficiency and safety.

It operates at a resonant frequency of 500 kHz and has a circular beam width of 3º. The transducer has a robust and rugged design, making it suitable for portable applications. It has a high bandwidth with a Q value of 2.3. The transducer also features a maximum pulse power input of 500 W at a 2% duty cycle and can operate at a maximum depth of 10 m. With a cable length of 10 m and a diameter of 7.0 mm, the transducer's weight with cable is 3.4 kg. It has an operational temperature range of -6 to +48 ºC and a storage temperature range of -20 to +70 ºC. The transducer is complemented by a beam pattern that showcases its performance across various beamwidths, providing users with a comprehensive understanding of its capabilities.

MBR 179 MK2 PORTABLE
MARITIME BROADBAND RADIO
The MBR 179 MK2 Portable is a kit consisting of a MBR 179 MK2 radio, tripod and cables for quick deployment. The
MBR Portable is delivered in two transportation hard cases and is perfect to use both on shore and on vessels which
requires quick deployment for temporary operation. The Maritime Broadband Radio is a smart antenna designed for
use in any application where resilient high-speed communication and high-capacity data transfer are crucial for
efficient and safe operation. With beamforming the MBR 179 provides steerable high-gain antenna direction in an
omnidirectional sector, ideal for vessels and moving assets. With narrow fan shaped antenna diagram, a strong link
margin is maintained and continuously updated as the unit is unaffected of vessel movements.
TECHNICAL SPECIFICATIONS
RF SPECIFICATIONS POWER
Radio type MBR 179 MK2 FCC Supply voltage Radio Unit 24 - 48 V DC
Frequency band 5725 MHz to 5850 MHz Supply voltage Portable PSU 110 - 240 V AC
Channel bandwidth 20 MHz Max. power consumption, full TX 210 W
Antenna gain 21 dBi
EIRP Up to 51 dBm ENVIRONMENTAL SPECIFICATIONS
Internal antenna elements 60 Operational temperature range
MBR Unit -40°C - +55°C
INTERFACES
Ethernet/LAN 1x RJ-45 Humidity (operating/storage)
MBR Unit (recommended) 20 to 100 % RH / 20 to 70 % RH
WEIGHTS AND DIMENSIONS
MBR unit 8.8 kg, 323 x 323 x 111 mm Ingress protection
Transportation case 1 100 x 47 x 17 cms, weight: 17.6 kgs MBR Unit IP66
Transportation case 2 46 x 31 x 61 cms, weight: 20.4 kgs
Specifications subject to change without any further notice.

Scraped Text:
MBR 189 MK2
MARITIME BROADBAND RADIO
The Maritime Broadband Radio is a smart antenna designed for use in any application where resilient high-
speed communication and high-capacity data transfer are crucial for efficient and safe operation. With real-time
beamforming, the MBR 189 adjusts the antenna direction for every IP datagram transmitted within a sector of 100°
x 100°. This operational sector can be increased by mounting multiple radios together, giving up to 360° azimuth
coverage. The MBR 189 is suitable for maritime land-to-sea and vessel-to-vessel communication.

General text:
Introduction
The Simrad 38/200 D Combi-transducer combines two transducers and a temperature sensor in a single housing, featuring a streamlined shape designed for hull mounting on small vessels. The order number for this product is KSV-203004. The transducer has common specifications such as nominal impedance of 75 ohms, maximum pulse power input of 1000 W, maximum continuous power input of 10 W, resistance NYC thermistor at 25° of 10 kohm, maximum transducer depth of 20 m, and a cable length of 15 m. Additionally, it has technical specifications for 200 kHz such as cable diameter of 10.6 ±0.5 mm, resonant frequency of 200 kHz, weight with cable of 8 kg, longitudinal and transverse beamwidth of 7 deg, storage temperature of -20 to 70°C, directivity of 28.5 dB, side lobes of less than -18 dB, back radiation of less than -30 dB, source level at 1000 W of 227 dB re 1µPa, and transmitting response of 178 dB re 1µPa per V. The technical specifications for 38 kHz include beamwidth longitudinal of 13 deg, beamwidth transverse of 21 deg, directivity of 21 dB, side lobes of less than -15 dB, back radiation of less than -25 dB, source level at 1000 W of 219 dB re 1µPa, and transmitting response of 170 dB re 1µPa per V.
Features:
- Combines two transducers and a temperature sensor in a single housing
 - Streamlined shape for hull mounting on small vessels
 - Nominal impedance of 75 ohms
 - Maximum pulse power input of 1000 W
 - Maximum continuous power input of 10 W
 - Resistance NYC thermistor at 25° of 10 kohm
 - Maximum transducer depth of 20 m
 - Cable length of 15 m
 - Resonant frequency of 200 kHz
 - Weight with cable of 8 kg
 - Longitudinal and transverse beamwidth of 7 deg
 - Storage temperature of -20 to 70°C
 - Directivity, side lobes, back radiation, source level, and transmitting response specifications for both 200 kHz and 38 kHz
Technical Specifications:
Common Specifications:
 - Nominal Impedance: 75 ohms
 - Maximum Pulse Power Input: 1000 W
 - Maximum Continuous Power Input: 10 W
 - Resistance NYC Thermistor at 25°: 10 kohm
 - Maximum Transducer Depth: 20 m
 - Cable Length: 15 m
Technical Specifications 200 kHz:
 - Cable Diameter: 10.6 ±0.5 mm
 - Resonant Frequency: 200 kHz
 - Weight with Cable: 8 kg
 - Beamwidth Longitudinal: 7 deg
 - Storage Temperature: -20 to 70°C
Technical Specifications 38 kHz:
 - Beamwidth Longitudinal: 13 deg
 - Beamwidth Transverse: 21 deg
 - Directivity: 21 dB
 - Side Lobes: less than -15 dB
 - Back Radiation: less than -25 dB
